author: Toby Eccles

author: Torsten Reil

author: Aakash Odedra

author: Aaron Koblin

author: Aaron O'Connell
description: Aaron O'Connell is the first person to experimentally induce and measure quantum effects in the motion of a humanmade object, bridging the quantum and classical worlds.

author: Abe Davis

author: Abraham Verghese

author: Adam Davidson
description: Adam Davidson is the co-host and co-creator of "Planet Money," a weekly podcast and radio feature about the economy.

author: Adam Foss
description: By shifting his focus from incarceration to transforming lives, Adam Foss is reinventing the role of the criminal prosecutor.

author: Adam Grant

author: Adam Grosser
description: Adam Grosser is a general partner at Foundation Capital _ã and a refrigeration visionary.

author: Adam Ockelford
description: A composer and music teacher who has long worked with children with special needs, Adam Ockelford is interested in the psychology of music.

author: Adam Ostrow
description: As editor in chief at Mashable, Adam Ostrow covers the tech, trends and people driving the evolution of the Web.

author: Adam Sadowsky
description: As the president of Syyn Labs, Adam Sadowsky merges art and technology to create interactive projects big and small.

author: Adam Savage
description: Adam Savage, the host of "MythBusters" on the Discovery Channel, is a longtime special-effects artist and a minor obsessive.

author: Adam Spencer
description: Radio host Adam Spencer fills Sydney's drive-time mornings with smart math and science talk.

author: Afra Raymond
description: A leading expert in the fields of property valuation and project management, Afra Raymond is battling the government corruption rampant in his country, Trinidad and Tobago.

author: Ajit Narayanan
description: Ajit Narayanan is the inventor of Avaz, an affordable, tablet-based communication device for people who are speech-impaired.

author: Al Gore

author: Al Vernacchio
description: In his 12th-grade Sexuality and Society class, Al Vernacchio speaks honestly and positively about human sexuality.

author: Alain de Botton
description: Through his witty and literate books _ã and his new School of Life  _ã Alain de Botton helps others find fulfillment in the everyday.

author: Alan Eustace
description: Alan Eustace leapt to Earth from the edge of the stratosphere wearing only a spacesuit, shattering skydiving records and potentially revolutionizing the commercial space industry.

author: Alan Russell
description: In the fight against disease, defect and injury, Alan Russell has a novel argument: Why not engineer new tissue and organs to replace sick ones?

author: Alan Siegel
description: A branding expert and one of the leading authorities on business communication, Alan Siegel wants to put plain English into legal documents for government and business.

author: Alastair Parvin
description: Alastair Parvin believes in making architecture accessible to 100 percent of the population.

author: Alberto Cairo
description: Alberto Cairo leads the International Red Cross' orthopedic rehabilitation work in Afghanistan.

author: Alec Soth
description: Alec Soth makes large-scale projects that are as much about dreams and heartache as they are about charting the landscape of Middle America.

author: Alejandro Aravena
description: Alejandro Aravena works inside paradoxes, seeing space and flexibility in public housing, clarity in economic scarcity, and the keys to rebuilding in the causes of natural disasters. He

author: Alessandro Acquisti
description: What motivates you to share your personal information online? Alessandro Acquisti studies the behavioral economics of privacy (and information security) in social networks.

author: Alex Kipman
description: With his latest invention, HoloLens, Kinect creator Alex Kipman has opened a virtual holographic universe for users to explore _ã and he may have changed the face of computing forever.

author: Alex Steffen
description: Alex Steffen explores our planet's future, telling powerful, inspiring stories about the hard choices facing humanity ... and our opportunity to create a much better tomorrow.

author: Alex Wissner-Gross
description: Alex Wissner-Gross applies science and engineering principles to big (and diverse) questions, like: "What is the equation for intelligence?" and "What's the best way to raise awareness about climate change?"

author: Alexander Tsiaras
description: Using art and technology, Alexander Tsiaras visualizes the unseen human body.

author: Alexis Ohanian
description: Alexis Ohanian is the co-founder an executive chairman of Reddit, a social-voting news website with geek allegiances, a small-town feel and a penchant for lighting up the memes your friends IM you about next week.

author: Allan Adams
description: Allan Adams is a theoretical physicist working at the intersection of fluid dynamics, quantum field theory and string theory.

author: Allan Savory
description: Allan Savory works to promote holistic management in the grasslands of the world.

author: Ami Klin
description: Ami Klin is an award winning autism spectrum disorder researcher finding new avenues for early diagnosis.

author: Amory Lovins
description: In his new book, "Reinventing Fire," Amory Lovins shares ingenious ideas for the next era of energy.

author: Amos Winter
description: Amos Winter and his team at MIT built the Leveraged Freedom Chair, a cheap lever-powered wheelchair whose design and develop put the user first.

author: Anand Agarawala
description: Anand Agarawala is the creator of BumpTop, an irresistible new desktop interface with a satisfyingly three-dimensional physicality and a fresh approach to interactivity.

author: Anand Giridharadas
description: Anand Giridharadas writes about people and cultures caught amid the great forces of our time.

author: Anand Varma
description: Anand Varma's photos tell the story behind the science on everything from primate behavior and hummingbird biomechanics to amphibian disease and forest ecology.

author: Anant Agarwal
description: Through blended courses Anant Agarwal is pairing online education with face-to-face student-faculty interactions, reshaping the university campus experience.

author: Anas Aremeyaw Anas
description: Anas Aremeyaw Anas is a Ghanaian undercover journalist and private eye who gathers hard evidence of crime and corruption, putting the perpetrators behind bars.

author: Anders Ynnerman
description: Anders Ynnerman studies the fundamental aspects of computer graphics and visualization, in particular large scale and complex data sets with a focus on volume rendering and multi-modal interaction.

author: Andreas Ekstrê_m
description: Andreas Ekstrê_m describes the power structures of the digital revolution.

author: Andreas Raptopoulos
description: Andreas Raptopoulos and his colleagues are building the flying internet of things, using drones to carry essential goods to otherwise inaccessible areas.

author: Andres Lozano

author: Andrê©s Ruzo

author: Andrew Bastawrous
description: Andrew Bastawrous studies eye health _ã and builds accessible new tools to bring eye health to more people. He is a 2014 TED Fellow.

author: Andrew Bird
description: Andrew Bird is a virtual one-man band _ã he_ã_s a singer and songwriter and plays the violin, guitar, glockenspiel.

author: Andrew Blum
description: For his new book, "Tubes," Andrew Blum visited the places where the internet exists in physical form: the cables and switches and servers that virtually connect us.

author: Andrew Connolly
description: Andrew Connolly is helping to build the Large Synoptic Survey Telescope _ã as well as tools to handle the massive datasets it will send our way.

author: Andrew Fitzgerald
description: Andrew Fitzgerald is shaping new ways for Twitter and journalists to work together.

author: Andrew McAfee
description: Andrew McAfee studies how information technology affects businesses and society.

author: Andrew Mwenda
description: Journalist Andrew Mwenda has spent his career fighting for free speech and economic empowerment throughout Africa. He argues that aid makes objects of the poor _ã they become passive recipients of charity rather than active participants in their own economic betterment.

author: Andrew Stanton
description: Andrew Stanton has made you laugh and cry. The writer behind the three "Toy Story" movies and the writer/director of "WALL-E," he releases his new film, "John Carter," in March.

author: Andy Hobsbawm
description: Andy Hobsbawm is the founder and CMO of Evrythng.com and the founder of

author: Andy Yen
description: Andy Yen is building an encrypted email program that lets everyone benefit from private communication.

author: Angelo Vermeulen
description: Angelo Vermeulen wears many hats, including one as a crew commander for NASA, another as an artist and community organizer.

author: Anil Ananthaswamy
description: Anil Ananthaswamy is the author of "The Edge of Physics." A former software engineer, he was inspired to become a science writer by his passionate curiosity about the world.

author: Anil Gupta
description: Anil Gupta created the Honey Bee Network to support grassroots innovators who are rich in knowledge, but not in resources.

author: Anote Tong
occupation: President of the Republic of Kiribati
description: Anote Tong has built worldwide awareness of the potentially devastating impacts of climate change.

author: Kwame Anthony Appiah
description: Kwame Anthony Appiah is a philosopher, cultural theorist and novelist. His latest book is "The Honor Code," exploring moral revolutions.

author: Antonio Damasio
description: Antonio Damasio's research in neuroscience has shown that emotions play a central role in social cognition and decision-making. His work has had a major influence on current understanding of the neural systems, which underlie memory, language, consciousness.

author: Antonio Donato Nobre
description: Antonio Donato Nobre researches the _ãingenious systems_ã of the Amazon. His work illustrates the beautiful complexity of this region, as well as its fragility against a backdrop of climate change.

author: Antê_nio Guterres
occupation: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
description: Antê_nio Guterres is at the forefront of advocating for refugee rights around the world.

author: Anupam Mishra
description: To promote smart water management, Anupam Mishra works to preserve rural India_ã_s traditional rainwater harvesting techniques.

author: Apollo Robbins
description: Apollo Robbins will take the phone from your pocket and the ring off your finger, then hand them back to you and (maybe) show you how he did it.

author: Aris Venetikidis
description: Aris Venetikidis imagines how maps work with our minds.

author: Arthur Benjamin
description: Using daring displays of algorithmic trickery, lightning calculator and number wizard Arthur Benjamin mesmerizes audiences with mathematical mystery and beauty.

author: Arthur Brooks
description: As president of the American Enterprise Institute, Arthur Brooks is changing the way conservatives think about poverty and opportunity.

author: Arthur Ganson
description: Arthur Ganson's kinetic metal sculptures mix high art with gearhead humor. He's also the inventor of the kids' construction toy Toobers & Zots.

author: Arthur Potts Dawson
description: Arthur Potts Dawson wants us to take responsibility not just for the food we eat, but how we shop for and even dispose of it. And he's showing the way _ã with impeccable taste.

author: Arunachalam Muruganantham
description: Arunachalam Muruganantham created a system of simple machines to make modern sanitary napkins _ã giving millions of women in his home country and around the world access to hygiene.

author: Arvind Gupta
description: Science educator Arvind Gupta uses simple toys to teach.

author: Ashraf Ghani
description: Ashraf Ghani, Afghanistan_ã_s new president-elect, and his opponent, Abdullah Abdullah, will share power in a national unity government. He previously served as Finance Minister and as a chancellor of Kabul University.

author: Astro Teller
description: As "Captain of Moonshots" for X, Astro Teller oversees the secret projects that could reshape our lives in coming decades.

author: Atul Gawande
description: Surgeon by day and public health journalist by night, Atul Gawande explores how doctors can dramatically improve their practice using something as simple as a checklist.

author: Aubrey de Grey
description: Aubrey de Grey, British researcher on aging, claims he has drawn a roadmap to defeat biological aging. He provocatively proposes that the first human beings who will live to 1,000 years old have already been born.

author: Auke Ijspeert
description: Auke Ijspeert works at the intersection of robotics, biology and computational neuroscience.

author: Auret van Heerden
description: At the head of the Fair Labor Association (FLA), Auret van Heerden takes a practical approach to workers' rights, persuading corporations and NGOs to protect labor in global supply chains.

author: Avi Reichental
description: At 3D Systems, Avi Reichental is helping to imagine a future where 3D scanning-and-printing is an everyday act, and food, clothing, objects are routinely output at home.

author: Avi Rubin
description: Avi Rubin is a professor of computer science and director of the Health and Medical Security Lab at Johns Hopkins University. His research is focused on the security of electronic records _ã including medical and voting records.

author: Aziz Abu Sarah
description: Aziz Abu Sarah helps people break down cultural and historical barriers through tourism.

author: Baba Shiv
description: Baba Shiv studies how _ãliking_ã and _ãwanting_ã shape the choices we make, and what that means in the world of marketing.

author: Bandi Mbubi
description: Bandi Mbubi would like to make sure that you are using a fair trade cell phone.

author: Barat Ali Batoor
description: Barat Ali Batoor, an award-winning photojournalist, is a member of the Hazara people. He is based in Australia.

author: Barry Schuler
description: Barry Schuler's multimedia firm Medior built key interactive technologies for AOL, helping millions connect to the Internet through a simple, accessible interface. Now, through venture capital (and wine appreciation), he wants to do the same for genomics.

author: Barry Schwartz
description: Barry Schwartz studies the link between economics and psychology, offering startling insights into modern life. Lately, working with Ken Sharpe, he's studying wisdom.

author: Bart Knols
description: Bart Knols is a doctor committed to killing mosquitoes and ending malaria.

author: Barton Seaver
description: Barton Seaver is an advocate of sustainable seafood and a chef in Washington DC. His work tells the story of our common resources through the communion we all share _ã_ dinner.

author: Bassam Tariq
description: Bassam Tariq delights in making eclectic career choices. A blogger, a filmmaker, and a butcher's shop owner, the common theme linking everything together is his boundless celebration of humanity.

author: Bastian Schaefer
description: Bastian Schaefer and a team of designers at Airbus have been imagining the high-concept future of the jet airlplane _ã in a future with less fuel and more passengers.

author: Beardyman
description: Beardyman, _ãruler of beats and destroyer of dance floors,_ã has developed a real-time music-production system that places live looping at the center of a new musical paradigm.

author: Ben Ambridge
description: Ben Ambridge is the author of "Psy-Q," a sparkling book debunking what we think we know about psychology.

author: Ben Cameron
description: Ben Cameron runs the arts granting program at the Doris Duke Foundation, focusing on live theater, dance and jazz.

author: Ben Dunlap

author: Ben Goldacre
description: Ben Goldacre unpicks dodgy scientific claims made by scaremongering journalists, dubious government reports, pharmaceutical corporations, PR companies and quacks.

author: Ben Kacyra
description: Ben Kacyra uses state-of-the-art technology to preserve cultural heritage sites and let us in on their secrets in a way never before possible.

author: Ben Katchor
description: The first MacArthur-winning cartoonist, Ben Katchor has collected both cult and mainstream hat tips for his wry, poetic creations that find uncanny humor (and color) in the commonplace deeds of a bygone New York City.

author: Ben Roche
description: Ben Roche is the pastry chef at Moto, in Chicago, and was the co-host, with Homaro Cantu, of the TV show "Future Food."

author: Ben Saunders
description: In 2004, Ben Saunders became the youngest person ever to ski solo to the North Pole. In 2013, he set out on another record-breaking expedition, this time to retrace Captain Scott_ã_s ill-fated journey to the South Pole on foot.

author: Ben Wellington
description: Ben Wellington blends his love of statistics, the city, and comedy in his entertaining analysis of the story of New York City, told through data.

author: Benjamin Barber
description: Benjamin Barber believes that the future of the world may lie with the politicians who implement practical change every day: mayors.

author: Benjamin Wallace
description: Benjamin Wallace is a journalist and author of The Billionaire's Vinegar, the true story of the world's most expensive bottle of (possibly phony?) wine. He's been a contributor to GQ, Details, Salon and The Washington Post.

author: Benjamin Zander
description: A leading interpreter of Mahler and Beethoven, Benjamin Zander is known for his charisma and unyielding energy _ã and for his brilliant pre-concert talks.

author: Benoit Mandelbrot
description: Benoit Mandelbrot's work led the world to a deeper understanding of fractals, a broad and powerful tool in the study of roughness, both in nature and in humanity's works.

author: Bertrand Piccard
description: Bertrand Piccard circumnavigated the Earth in a hot-air balloon. Now he wants to circle it in an airplane powered only by solar energy.

author: Bilal Bomani
description: Bilal Bomani runs NASA_ã_s Greenlab research facility, where he is developing the next generation of biofuels.

author: Bill Clinton
description: Through his William J. Clinton Foundation, former US President Bill Clinton has become a vital and innovative force for world change. He works in four critical areas: health, economic empowerment, citizen service, and reconciliation.

author: Bill Davenhall
description: Bill Davenhall wants to improve physicians' diagnostic techniques by collecting each patient's geographic and environmental data, and merging it with their medical records.

author: Bill Doyle
description: With his company Novocure, Bill Doyle works to bring breakthrough medical technologies to doctors and patients.

author: Bill Ford
description: As executive chair of the Ford Motor Company, Bill Ford leads the company that put the world on wheels.

author: Bill Gates
description: A passionate techie and a shrewd businessman, Bill Gates changed the world while leading Microsoft to dizzying success. Now he's doing it again with his own style of philanthropy and passion for innovation.

author: Bill Gross
description: Bill Gross founded Idealab, an incubator of new inventions, ideas and businesses.

author: Bill Joy
description: The co-founder of Sun Microsystems, Bill Joy has, in recent years, turned his attention to the biggest questions facing humanity: Where are we going? What could go wrong? What's the next great thing?

author: Bill Stone
occupation: Explorer, inventor and outer space dreamer
description: Engineer and daredevil caver Bill Stone pushes the frontier _ã through flooded tunnels, the remotest depths of the Earth and the limits of human endurance.

author: Bill Strickland
description: As a Pittsburgh youth besieged by racism in the crumbling remains of the steel economy, Bill Strickland should have been one of the Rust Belt's casualties. Instead, he discovered the potter's wheel, and the transforming power of fountains, irrepressible dreams, and the slide show.

author: Bill T. Jones
description: With his artistry and creativity, Bill T. Jones has inspired a generation of dancers, choreographers _ã and audiences.

author: Billy Collins
description: A two-term U.S. Poet Laureate, Billy Collins captures readers with his understated wit, profound insight _ã and a sense of being "hospitable."

author: Billy Graham
description: The Rev. Billy Graham is a religious leader with a worldwide reach. In his long career as an evangelist, he has spoken to millions and been an advisor to US presidents.

author: Birke Baehr
description: Birke Baehr wants us to know how our food is made, where it comes from, and what's in it. At age 11, he's planning a career as an organic farmer.

author: BJ Miller
description: Using empathy and a clear-eyed view of mortality, BJ Miller shines a light on healthcare_ã_s most ignored facet: preparing for death. He is executive director at Zen Hospice Project in San Francisco.

author: Bjarke Ingels
description: Theory meets pragmatism meets optimism in Bjarke Ingels' architecture. His big-think approach is informed by a hands-on, ground-up understanding of the needs of a building's occupants and surroundings.

author: Bjorn Lomborg
description: Danish political scientist Bjorn Lomborg heads the Copenhagen Consensus, which has prioritized the world's greatest problems _ã global warming, world poverty, disease _ã based on how effective our solutions might be. It's a thought-provoking, even provocative list.

author: BLACK
description: Twice the world yo-yo champion, BLACK mixes dance, sport and performance to create unforgettable yo-yo moments.

author: Blaise Agê_era y Arcas
description: Blaise Agê_era y Arcas works on machine learning at Google. Previously a Distinguished Engineer at Microsoft, he has worked on augmented reality, mapping, wearable computing and natural user interfaces. He was the co-creator of Photosynth, software that assembles photos into 3D environments.

author: Boaz Almog
description: Boaz Almog uses quantum physics to levitate and trap objects in midair. Call it "quantum levitation."

author: Bob Mankoff
description: Bob Mankoff is the cartoon editor of The New Yorker, as well as an accomplished cartoonist in his own right.

author: Robert Thurman
description: The first American to be ordained a Tibetan Monk by the Dalai Lama, Robert A.F. Thurman is a scholar, author and tireless proponent of peace.

author: Bobby Ghosh
description: Bobby Ghosh is the Managing Editor at Quartz.

author: Bono
description: Bono, the lead singer of U2, uses his celebrity to fight for social justice worldwide: to end hunger, poverty and disease, especially in Africa. His nonprofit ONE raises awareness via media, policy and calls to action.

author: Boyd Varty
description: In his native South Africa, Boyd Varty builds wildlife corridors to restore the environment and literacy centers to restore the human spirit.

author: David Steindl-Rast
description: Brother David Steindl-Rast, a Benedictine monk, meditates and writes on "the gentle power" of gratefulness.

author: Brewster Kahle
description: Brewster Kahle is an inventor, philanthropist and digital librarian. His Internet Archive offers 85 billion pieces of deep Web geology _ã a fascinating look at the formation of the Internet over the years, and a challenge to those who would keep knowledge buried.

author: Brian Cox
description: Physicist Brian Cox has two jobs: working with the Large Hadron Collider at CERN, and explaining big science to the general public. He's a professor at the University of Manchester.

author: Brian Dettmer
description: Artist Brian Dettmer digs into a good book (literally, with a knife) to create beautifully intricate forms that reflect how we see old information in a modern world.

author: Brian Goldman
description: Brian Goldman is an emergency-room physician in Toronto, and the host of CBC Radio_ã_s "White Coat, Black Art."

author: Brian Greene
description: Brian Greene is perhaps the best-known proponent of superstring theory, the idea that minuscule strands of energy vibrating in a higher dimensional space-time create every particle and force in the universe.

author: Brian Skerry
description: Brian Skerry is a photojournalist who captures images that not only celebrate the mystery and beauty of the sea but also bring attention to the pressing issue which endanger our oceans.

author: Bruce Aylward
description: As the Assistant Director-General of the World Health Organization_ã_s Polio and Emergencies Cluster, Bruce Aylward works to ensure that polio stays under control and that the world is prepared to respond to health crises.

author: Bruce Bueno de Mesquita
description: A consultant to the CIA and the Department of Defense, Bruce Bueno de Mesquita has built an intricate computer model that can predict the outcomes of international conflicts with bewildering accuracy.

author: Bruce Feiler
description: Bruce Feiler is the author of "The Secrets of Happy Families," and the writer/presenter of the PBS miniseries "Walking the Bible."

author: Bruce McCall
description: Illustrator and humorist Bruce McCall paints our imagined future _ã a supercharged, streamlined fantasyland that teeters on the edge of hysteria.

author: Bruce Schneier
description: Bruce Schneier thinks hard about security _ã as a computer security guru, and as a philosopher of the larger notion of making a safer world.

author: Bruno Bowden
description: An engineer with Google (he helped build Google Earth), Bruno Bowden is also an enthusiastic folder of paper.

author: Bryan Stevenson
description: Bryan Stevenson is the founder and executive director of the Equal Justice Initiative, fighting poverty and challenging racial discrimination in the criminal justice system.

author: Burt Rutan
description: In 2004, legendary spacecraft designer Burt Rutan won the $10M Ansari X-Prize for SpaceShipOne, the first privately funded craft to enter space twice in a two-week period. He's now collaborating with Virgin Galactic to build the first rocketship for space tourism.

author: C.K. Williams
description: Often called a social poet, C.K. Williams was fascinated by the characters of modern civilization and their interactions.

author: Caleb Chung
description: Caleb Chung dreams up toys that interact with children. He's the inventor of Furby, a talking (and listening) robotic furball that sold some 50 million units in the late '90s. His newest plaything: Pleo the adorable robot dinosaur.

author: Caleb Harper
occupation: Principal Investigator and Director of the Open Agriculture Initiative
description: Caleb Harper leads a group of engineers, architects, urban planners, economists and plant scientists in the exploration and development of high performance urban agricultural systems.

author: Cameron Sinclair
description: 2006 TED Prize winner Cameron Sinclair is co-founder of Architecture for Humanity, a nonprofit that seeks architecture solutions to global crises _ã and acts as a conduit between the design community and the world's humanitarian needs.

author: Carl Honore
description: In his book In Praise of Slowness, Carl Honorê© dissects our speed-obsessed society and celebrates those who have gotten in touch with their "inner tortoise."

author: Carl Safina
description: Carl Safina's writing explores the scientific, moral and social dimensions of our relationship with nature.

author: Carl Schoonover
description: Carl Schoonover is a neuroscientist and one of the founders of NeuWrite, a collaboration between writers and neuroscientist.

author: Carlo Ratti
description: Carlo Ratti directs the MIT SENSEable City Lab, which explores the "real-time city" by studying the way sensors and electronics relate to the built environment.

author: Carter Emmart
description: Carter Emmart uses astronomy and computational modeling to create scientifically accurate, three-dimensional tours of our universe.

author: Cary Fowler
description: Biodiversity warrior Cary Fowler wants to save the world from agricultural collapse, one seed at a time.

author: Cesar Harada
description: TED Senior Fellow Cesar Harada aims to harness the forces of nature as he invents innovative remedies for man-made problems like oil spills and radioactive leaks.

author: Cesar Kuriyama
description: Cesar Kuriyama shoots one second of video every day of his life, and edits them together into a montage that prompts him to think how he approaches each day.

author: Chade-Meng Tan
description: One of Google's earliest engineers, Chade-Meng Tan is now Google's Jolly Good Fellow _ã the head of personal growth at the groundbreaking search company.

author: Charles Anderson
description: Charles Anderson studies marine life in the Maldives, a nation of coral atolls in the Indian ocean.

author: Charles Elachi
description: Charles Elachi is the director of NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, where he oversees space exploration programs such as the Mars Rovers.

author: Charles Fleischer
description: Best known as the voice of Roger Rabbit, Charles Fleischer's multi-decade career includes work on stage and on screen, and an online emporium of unusual observations called MonkeyDog.

author: Charles Hazlewood
description: Charles Hazlewood dusts off and invigorates classical music, adding a youthful energy and modern twists to centuries-old masterworks. At TEDGlobal, he conducts the Scottish Ensemble.

author: Charles Leadbeater
description: A researcher at the London think tank Demos, Charles Leadbeater was early to notice the rise of "amateur innovation" _ã great ideas from outside the traditional walls, from people who suddenly have the tools to collaborate, innovate and make their expertise known.

author: Charles Limb
description: Charles Limb is a doctor and a musician who researches the way musical creativity works in the brain.

author: Charles Moore
description: Charles Moore is founder of the Algalita Marine Research Foundation. He captains the foundation's research vessel, the Alguita, documenting the great expanses of plastic waste that now litter our oceans.

author: Charles Robertson
description: In "The Fastest Billion," Charles Robertson re-examines the narrative of economic growth in African nations.

author: Charlie Todd
description: Charlie Todd is the creator of Improv Everywhere, a group that creates absurd and joyful public scenes.

author: Chip Conley
description: Chip Conley creates joyful hotels, where he hopes his employees, customers and investors alike can realize their full potential. His books share that philosophy with the wider world.

author: Chip Kidd
description: Chip Kidd's book jacket designs spawned a revolution in the art of American book packaging.

author: Chris Abani
description: Imprisoned three times by the Nigerian government, Chris Abani turned his experience into poems that Harold Pinter called "the most naked, harrowing expression of prison life and political torture imaginable." His novels include GraceLand (2004) and The Virgin of Flames (2007).

author: Chris Anderson

description: Physicist Geoffrey West believes that complex systems from organisms to cities are in many ways governed by simple laws _ã laws that can be discovered and analyzed.

author: George Dyson
description: In telling stories of technologies and the individuals who created them, George Dyson takes a clear-eyed view of our scientific past _ã while illuminating what lies ahead.

author: George Monbiot
description: In his book "Feral," George Monbiot advocates the large-scale restoration of complex natural ecosystems.

author: George Papandreou
description: George Papandreou draws on lessons learned from the Greek debt crisis as he helps guide the EU through difficult waters.

author: George Smoot
description: Astrophysicist, cosmologist and Nobel Prize winner George Smoot studies the cosmic microwave background radiation _ã the afterglow of the Big Bang. His pioneering research into deep space and time is uncovering the structure of the universe itself.

author: George Takei
description: The beloved Mr. Sulu from the original Star Trek, George Takei is an activist for human rights (and a master of Facebook memes).

author: George Whitesides
description: In his legendary career in chemistry, George Whitesides has been a pioneer in microfabrication and nanoscale self-assembly. Now, he's fabbing a diagnostic lab on a chip.

author: Gian Giudice

author: Glenn Greenwald
description: Glenn Greenwald is the journalist who has done the most to expose and explain the Edward Snowden files.

author: Golan Levin
description: Half performance artist, half software engineer, Golan Levin manipulates the computer to create improvised soundscapes with dazzling corresponding visuals. He is at the forefront of defining new parameters for art.

author: Gordon Brown
description: Britain's former prime minister Gordon Brown played a key role in shaping the G20 nations' response to the world's financial crisis, and was a powerful advocate for a coordinated global response to problems such as climate change, poverty and social justice.

author: Graham Hawkes

author: Graham Hill

author: Greg Asner
description: Greg Asner_ã_s mapping technology produces detailed, complex pictures of how humans_ã_ activities affect our ecosystems.

author: Greg Gage
description: Greg Gage helps kids investigate the neuroscience in their own backyards.

author: Greg Lynn
description: Greg Lynn is the head of Greg Lynn FORM, an architecture firm known for its boundary-breaking, biomorphic shapes and its embrace of digital tools for design and fabrication.

author: Greg Stone
description: Greg Stone was a key driver in the establishment of the Phoenix Island Protected Area in the island nation of Kiribati. The second-largest marine protected area in the world _ã and one of the most pristine _ã PIPA is a laboratory for exploring and monitoring the recovery of coral reefs from bleaching events.

author: Grê©goire Courtine
description: Grê©goire Courtine and his interdisciplinary lab imagine new ways to recover after devastating, mobility-impairing injury to the spinal cord.

author: Gregory Heyworth
description: Gregory Heyworth uses spectral imaging technology to uncover lost classics that could rewrite history.

author: Gregory Stock
description: Dr. Gregory Stock's levelheaded look at the hotpoints where tech and ethics connect (or short circuit) have made him a popular guest on TV and radio. He directs the Program on Science, Technology, and Society at UCLA.

author: Guillaume Nê©ry
description: With just one breath, Guillaume Nê©ry can dive to -125m below the water's surface.

author: Guy Hoffman

author: Guy-Philippe Goldstein
description: Guy-Philippe Goldstein is the author of Babel Minute Zero, a novel that examines the reality of cyberwar in our current geopolitical topography.

author: Guy Winch

author: Hadyn Parry
description: Biotech entrepreneur Hadyn Parry leads a science start-up that develops GM insects to fight dengue fever.

author: Hamish Jolly
description: Hamish Jolly brings his entrepreneurial eye to the rare but viscerally terrifying issue of shark attacks.

author: Hans Rosling

author: Harald Haas
description: Harald Haas is the pioneer behind a new technology that can communicate as well as illuminate.

author: Harish Manwani
description: Harish Manwani joined Unilever as a management trainee in 1976; he is now the company's chief operating officer.

author: Harry Baker
description: From primes to proper pop-up purple paper people, Harry Baker performs his pun-tastic and poignant poetry.

author: Harry Cliff
description: Harry Cliff looks for answers to questions about the origins of the universe and the laws of nature.

author: Harsha Bhogle
description: Harsha Bhogle can talk about the business side of cricket, the technicalities of play and the psychology of the players with equal authority.

author: Harvey Fineberg
description: Harvey Fineberg studies medical decisionmaking _ã from how we roll out new medical technology, to how we cope with new illnesses and threatened epidemics.

author: Hasan Elahi

author: Hector Ruiz

author: Helder Guimarê£es
description: Using a deck of cards and other simple props, Helder Guimarê£es gets up close to play with your perceptions and preconceptions.

author: Hetain Patel

author: Hillel Cooperman

author: Howard Rheingold

author: Hugh Evans

author: Iain Hutchison

author: Ian Goldin
description: Ian Goldin is director of the Oxford Martin School. Through the school's program of research, collaboration and education, he's powering new, cross-disciplinary thinking about global problems from the near and far future.

author: Ian Ritchie
description: Ian Ritchie

author: Isaac Mizrahi

author: Ismael Nazario
description: Prison reform advocate Ismael Nazario helps former inmates from New York's Rikers Island jail reenter society.

author: Ivan Krastev

author: J.J. Abrams

author: Jack Andraka

description: Jackson Katz asks a very important question that gets at the root of why sexual abuse, rape and domestic abuse remain a problem: What's going on with men?

author: Jaime Lerner

author: Jake Wood
description: Jake Wood runs Team Rubicon, a nationwide nonprofit that provides military veterans with the opportunity to continue their service by responding to natural disasters and global crises.

author: Jakob Trollback

author: Jamais Cascio
description: Jamais Cascio follows the threads of civilization's intended (and unintended) consequences into an unpredictable future, bringing back glimpses of a green world wired beyond our wildest dreams.

author: James A. White Sr.

author: James Balog
description: James Balog's latest work, the Extreme Ice Survey, captures the twisting, soaring forms of threatened wild ice.

author: James Forbes
description: Known as the preacher_ã_s preacher, Rev. James Forbes is a spiritual leader with charismatic style and radically progressive opinions.

author: James Geary
description: Lost jobs, wayward lovers, wars and famine _ã come to think of it, just about any of life's curveballs _ã there's an aphorism for it, and James Geary's got it.

author: James Hansen
description: James Hansen has made key insights into our global climate _ã and inspired a generation of activists and scientists.

author: James Lyne
description: Whether he_ã_s taking on insecure hotspots, inept passwords, or lax OS designers, James Lyne exposes technology_ã_s vulnerabilities while elevating the security awareness of everyday users.

author: James Nachtwey

author: James Patten
description: James Patten, a TED Fellow, imagines new ways for us to play with computers.

author: James Randi
description: Legendary skeptic James Randi has devoted his life to debunking frauds and investigating paranormal and pseudoscientific claims.

author: James Stavridis
description: What will 21st-century security look like? Navy Admiral James Stavridis suggests that dialogue and openness will be the game-changers.

author: James Surowiecki

author: James Veitch
description: For James Veitch, a British writer and comedian with a mischievous side, spam emails proved the perfect opening to have some fun, playing the scammers at their own game.

author: James Watson

author: Jamie Bartlett
description: In his book "The Dark Net," Jamie Bartlett investigates Internet subcultures, both legal and illegal.

author: Jamie Heywood
description: When MIT-trained mechanical engineer Jamie Heywood discovered that his younger brother was diagnosed with the terminal illness ALS, he focused all his energy on founding revolutionary healthcare initiatives to help his brother and others like him.

author: Jamie Oliver
description: Jamie Oliver is transforming the way we feed ourselves, and our children.

author: Jamil Abu-Wardeh

author: Jan Chipchase
description: As Executive Creative Director of global insights for frog design, Jan Chipchase travels around the world and inside our pockets in search of behavioral patterns that will inform the design of products we don't even know we want. Yet.

author: Jared Ficklin
description: In his day job, Jared Ficklin makes user interfaces at frog design. As a hobby, he explores what music looks like ... in light, in shapes, in fire.

author: Jarreth Merz
description: Jarreth Merz' new film, "An African Election," follows the 2008 presidential elections in Ghana from start to finish.

author: Jarrett J. Krosoczka
description: Jarrett J. Krosoczka is the author/illustrator of countless children's books and graphic novels, including Good Night, Monkey Boy, Baghead and the Lunch Lady series.

author: Jason deCaires Taylor
description: Jason deCaires Taylor's underwater installations offer views of another world, where the artistic efforts of man meet the vivifying power of nature.

author: Jason Fried
description: Jason Fried thinks deeply about collaboration, productivity and the nature of work. He's the co-founder of 37signals, makers of Basecamp and other web-based collaboration tools, and co-author of "Rework."

author: Jason McCue
description: Jason McCue litigates against terrorists, dictators and others who seem above the law, using the legal and judicial system in innovative ways.

author: Jason Pontin
description: Jason Pontin is the editor-in-chief and publisher of MIT Technology Review.

author: Jay Bradner
description: In his lab, Jay Bradner, a researcher at Harvard and Dana Farber in Boston, works on a breakthrough approach for subverting cancer .. and he_ã_s giving the secret away.

author: Jay Silver
description: Jay Silver and Eric Rosenbaum's MaKey MaKey kit lets you turn everyday objects into computer interfaces _ã inspiring both fun and practical new inventions.

author: Jay Walker
description: Jay Walker is fascinated by intellectual property in all its forms. His firm, Walker Digital, created Priceline and many other businesses that reframe old problems with new IT. In his private life, he's a bibliophile and collector on an epic scale.

author: JD Schramm
description: JD Schramm teaches future business leaders both the theoretical and practical aspects of communication.

author: Jean-Baptiste Michel
description: Jean-Baptiste Michel looks at how we can use large volumes of data to better understand our world.

author: Jean-Baptiste Michel
description: Jean-Baptiste Michel looks at how we can use large volumes of data to better understand our world.

author: Jean-Paul Mari
description: Jean-Paul Mari has reported on conflicts in more than three dozen countries.

author: Jeff Han

author: Jeff Hancock
description: Jeff Hancock studies how we interact by email, text message and social media blips, seeking to understand how technology mediates communication.

author: Jeff Speck
description: Jeff Speck is a city planner and the author of "Walkable City."

author: Jeremy Heimans
description: At Purpose, Jeremy Heimans strategizes how to harness new social, economic and technological models to build movements with impact.

author: Jeremy Howard
description: Jeremy Howard imagines how advanced machine learning can improve our lives.

author: Jeremy Jackson
description: A leader in the study of the ecology and evolution of marine organisms, Jeremy Jackson  is known for his deep understanding of geological time.

author: Jim Fallon
description: Sloan Scholar, Fulbright Fellow, Professor Emeritus of Neuroscience, Jim Fallon looks at the way nature and nurture intermingle to wire up the human brain.

author: James Flynn
description: James Flynn challenges our fundamental assumptions about intelligence.

author: Jim Holt
description: Why is there something rather than nothing? In his book "Why Does the World Exist?" Jim Holt dares to ask.

author: Jim Simons
description: After astonishing success as a mathematician, code breaker and billionaire hedge fund manager, Jim Simons is mastering yet another field: philanthropy.

author: Jim Toomey
description: For the past 13 years, Jim Toomey has been writing and drawing the daily comic strip Sherman_ã_s Lagoon, about a daffy family of ocean dwellers.

author: Jinsop Lee
description: Jinsop Lee is an industrial designer who believes that great design appeals to all five senses.

author: Joachim de Posada
description: Joachim de Posada was a speaker and motivational coach. He was the author of "How to Survive Among the Piranhas" and "Don't Eat the Marshmallow ... Yet."

author: Joe DeRisi

author: Joe Gebbia
description: As a designer, entrepreneur and the co-founder and Chief Product Officer of Airbnb, Joe Gebbia helped redesign the way the world travels and people connect.

author: Joe Kowan
description: By day he's a graphic designer, and by night Joe Kowan is a quirky folk singer-songwriter.

author: Joe Landolina
description: Joe Landolina is a TED Fellow and the inventor of VETI-GEL.

author: Joe Madiath
description: Joe Madiath brings Indian villagers together around water and sanitation projects.

author: Joe Sabia
description: Joe Sabia investigates new ways to tell stories _ã meshing viral video and new display technologies with old-fashioned narrative.

author: Joe Smith
description: Joe Smith is an active figure in the Oregon community and a powerful advocate for proper paper towel use.

author: Joel Selanikio
description: Dr. Joel Selanikio combines technology and data to help solve global health challenges.

author: Joey Alexander
description: Young piano player Joey Alexander has an old soul's gift for jazz.

author: Johan Rockstrom
description: Johan Rockstrê_m works to redefine sustainable development, and figure out what needs to happen.

author: John Bohannon
description: John Bohannon is a scientist and writer who runs the annual Dance Your Ph.D. contest.

author: John Delaney

description: John Francis walks the Earth, carrying a message of careful, truly sustainable development and respect for our planet.

author: John Gerzema
description: John Gerzema uses data, analysis and decades of experience to identify trends and develop daring new approaches to advertising.

author: John Graham-Cumming
description: Computer programmer John Graham-Cumming keeps geek history alive by raising awareness for it's heroes and their inventions.

author: John Hockenberry
description: Journalist and commentator John Hockenberry has reported from all over the world in virtually every medium. He's the author of "Moving Violations: War Zones, Wheelchairs and Declarations of Independence."

author: John Hodgman
description: John Hodgman is a writer, humorist, geek celebrity, former professional literary agent and expert on all world knowledge. He was the bumbling PC in Apple's long-running "I'm a Mac; I'm a PC" ad campaign.

author: John Hunter

author: John La Grou
description: John La Grou, a long-time electronics inventor, audio designer and entrepreneur, wants to save lives (and energy) with a new, smarter type of electrical outlet.

author: John Lloyd
description: John Lloyd helps make some of the cleverest television in the UK.

author: John Maeda
description: John Maeda, the former president of the Rhode Island School of Design, is dedicated to linking design and technology. Through the software tools, web pages and books he creates, he spreads his philosophy of elegant simplicity.

author: John McWhorter
description: Linguist John McWhorter thinks about language in relation to race, politics and our shared cultural history.

author: Johnny Lee
description: Researcher Johnny Lee became a YouTube star with his demo of Wii Remote hacks _ã bending the low-cost game piece to power an interactive whiteboard, a multitouch surface, a head-mounted display ...

author: Joi Ito
description: Joi Ito is the director of the MIT Media Lab.

author: Jok Church
description: Jok Church created the science-education comic strip "You Can with Beakman and Jax" and the zany TV series "Beakman's World."

author: Jon Gosier
description: Jon Gosier is a serial tech entrepreneur and early-stage startup investor. In 2015, Time magazine listed him as one of the "12 New Faces of Black Leadership."

author: Jon Nguyen
description: Jon Nguyen is an award winning aeronautics and graphics engineer at NASA.

author: Jon Ronson
description: Jon Ronson is a writer and documentary filmmaker who dips into every flavor of madness, extremism and obsession.

author: Jonas Gahr Stêªre
description: Jonas Gahr Stêªre is the Norwegian Foreign Minister, charged with working for Norway's interests internationally.

author: Jonathan Drori

author: Jonathan Foley

author: Jonathan Haidt

author: Jonathan Harris
description: Artist and computer scientist Jonathan Harris makes online art that captures the world's expression _ã and gives us a glimpse of the soul of the Internet.

author: Jonathan Klein

author: Jonathan Trent

author: Jonathan Zittrain
description: Jonathan Zittrain wants to make sure the electronic frontier stays open _ã and he's looking to the Internet's millions of users for its salvation.

author: Jorge Soto
description: Jorge Soto is helping develop a simple, noninvasive test that identifies cancer.

author: Jose Miguel Sokoloff

author: Joseph DeSimone
description: The CEO of Carbon3D, Joseph DeSimone has made breakthrough contributions to the field of 3D printing.

author: Joseph Kim

author: Joseph Lekuton
description: A teacher, writer and member of the Kenyan parliament, Joseph Lekuton has an inspiring vision for Kenya.

author: Joseph Nye
description: The former assistant secretary of defense and former dean of Harvard's Kennedy School of Government, Joseph Nye offers sharp insights into the way nations take and cede power.

author: Joshua Foer
description: Joshua Foer is a science writer who 'accidentally' won the U.S. Memory Championship.

author: Joshua Prager
description: Joshua Prager_ã_s journalism unravels historical secrets _ã and his own.

author: Joshua Prince-Ramus
description: Joshua Prince-Ramus is best known as architect of the Seattle Central Library, already being hailed as a masterpiece of contemporary culture. Prince-Ramus was the founding partner of OMA New York_ãthe American affiliate of the Office for Metropolitan Architecture (OMA) in the Netherlands_ãand served as its Principal until he renamed the firm REX in 2006.

author: Joshua Roman
description: Joshua Roman, a TED Fellow, is an independent-minded cellist.

author: Joshua Silver

author: Joshua Walters
description: Joshua Walters is a bipolar comedian whose work explores language, creativity, beatboxing and madness ...

author: JP Rangaswami
description: JP Rangaswami thinks deeply (and hilariously) about disruptive data.

author: Juan Enriquez
description: Juan Enriquez thinks and writes about profound changes that genomics will bring in business, technology, and society.

author: Judson Brewer
description: Psychiatrist and addiction expert Judson Brewer researches mindfulness techniques that effectively help quell cravings of all kinds.

author: Julian Assange
description: Internet activist Julian Assange serves as spokesperson for WikiLeaks, a controversial, volunteer-driven website that publishes and comments on leaked documents alleging government and corporate misconduct.

author: Julian Baggini
description: Julian Baggini is a journalist and philosopher who studies the complexities of personal identity. He is the editor-in-chief of the Philosophers' Magazine.

author: Julian Treasure
description: Julian Treasure studies sound and advises businesses on how best to use it.

author: Justin Hall-Tipping
description: Justin Hall-Tipping works on nano-energy startups _ã mastering the electron to create power.

author: Kailash Satyarthi
description: 2014 Nobel Peace Prize winner Kailash Satyarthi is a tireless activist fighting to protect the rights of voiceless children everywhere.

author: Kamal Meattle
description: With its air-filtering plants and sustainable architecture, Kamal Meattle's office park in New Delhi is a model of green business. Meattle himself is a longtime activist for cleaning up India's air.

author: Kang Lee
description: Kang Lee has devoted his career to understanding the development of social cognition and behavior.

author: Kartick Satyanarayan
description: Kartick Satyanarayan works tirelessly to save India_ã_s wild animals from illegal captivity and poaching _ã most notably rescuing hundreds of _ãdancing_ã bears.

author: Kary Mullis
description: Kary Mullis won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for developing a way to copy a strand of DNA. (His technique, called PCR, jump-started the 1990s' biorevolution.) He's known for his wide-ranging interests _ã and strong opinions.

author: Kees Moeliker
description: Kees Moeliker writes and speaks about natural history, especially birds and remarkable animal behavior, as well as improbable research and science-communication-with-a-laugh.

author: Keith Barry
description: Think of Keith Barry as a hacker of the human brain _ã writing routines that exploit its bugs and loopholes, and offering a revealing look at the software between our ears.

author: Keller Rinaudo
description: Keller Rinaudo is the co-founder and CEO of Romotive _ã makers of the small, covetable robot, Romo.

author: Ken Goldberg
description: Ken Goldberg works reflect the intersection of robotics, social media, and art.

author: Ken Jennings
description: Ken Jennings holds the record for most consecutive wins on the classic American trivia game show, Jeopardy.

author: Ken Kamler
description: Ken Kamler has served as doctor on some of the world_ã_s most daring expeditions, but also performs delicate microsurgery when at home in New York.

author: Kenichi Ebina
description: 2013 "America's Got Talent" winner Kenichi Ebina blends hip-hop, martial arts, modern dance, magic and a blast of pop culture in his mesmerizing performances.

author: Kenneth Cukier
description: Kenneth Cukier is the Data Editor of The Economist. From 2007 to 2012 he was the Tokyo correspondent, and before that, the paper_ã_s technology correspondent in London, where his work focused on innovation, intellectual property and Internet governance. Kenneth is also the co-author of Big Data: A Revolution That Will Transform How We Live, Work, and Think with Viktor Mayer-Schê_nberger in 2013, which was a New York Times Bestseller and translated into 16 languages.

author: Kenneth Lacovara
description: In his quest to understand the largest dinosaurs to have walked the Earth, Lacovara blends exploration with the latest imaging and modeling techniques from engineering to medicine.

author: Kenneth Shinozuka
description: Kenneth Shinozuka designs smart products ... He's been doing so since he was in kindergarten.

author: Kent Larson
description: Kent Larson designs new technologies that solve the biggest questions facing our cities.

author: Kevin Allocca
description: Kevin Allocca watches YouTube videos. For his job.

author: Kevin Bales
description: Kevin Bales is the co-founder of Free the Slaves, whose mission is to end all forms of human slavery within the next 25 years. He's the author of "Ending Slavery: How We Free Today's Slaves."

author: Kevin Breel
description: Writer, comic and mental health activist Kevin Breel speaks up about depression.

author: Kevin Briggs
description: As a member of the California Highway Patrol with assignments including patrolling the Golden Gate Bridge, Sergeant Kevin Briggs and his staff are the last barriers between would-be suicides and the plunge to near-certain death.

author: Kevin Kelly
description: Kevin Kelly has been publisher of the Whole Earth Review, exec editor at WIRED, founder of visionary nonprofits, and writer on biology and business and "cool tools." He's admired for his new perspectives on technology and its relevance to history, biology and religion.

author: Kevin Rudd
description: While studying future alternatives for China_ã_s global relations, former Australian Prime Minister Kevin Rudd has come to an ominous conclusion: conflict is looming.

author: Kevin Stone
description: Kevin Stone's clinic treats joint injury using the latest in bio-medicine: reconstructing damaged tissue, even replacing whole joint parts, with lab-grown cartilage and ligament.

author: Kirby Ferguson
description: Kirby Ferguson explores creativity in a world where "everything is a remix."

author: Kirk Citron
description: Kirk Citron began his career as a fast-rising advertising executive, but now writes and provides media consultation for select non-profits.

author: Raghava KK
description: Raghava KK's paintings and drawings use cartoonish shapes and colors to examine the body, society, our world.

author: Knut Haanaes
description: BCG's Knut Haanaes believes that the secret to creating lasting, impactful companies is to find a balance between doing what you're good at and looking for new challenges to take on.

author: Kwabena Boahen
description: Kwabena Boahen wants to understand how brains work _ã and to build a computer that works like the brain by reverse-engineering the nervous system. His group at Stanford is developing Neurogrid, a hardware platform that will emulate the cortex_ã_s inner workings.

author: Lalitesh Katragadda
description: Lalitesh Katragadda builds tools that help groups of people compile information to build something greater than the sum of its parts. His latest fascination: collaborative maps.

author: Larry Brilliant
description: 2006 TED Prize winner Dr. Larry Brilliant has spent his career solving the ills of today _ã from overseeing the last smallpox cases to saving millions from blindness _ã and building technologies of the future. Now, as President and CEO of the Skoll Global Threats Fund , he's redefining how we solve the world's biggest problems.

author: Larry Burns
description: Larry Burns is the vice president of R&D for GM. His job? Find a new way to power cars.

author: Lawrence Lessig
description: Lawrence Lessig has already transformed intellectual-property law with his Creative Commons innovation. Now he's focused on an even bigger problem: The US' broken political system.

author: Larry Smith
occupation: Professor of Economics, University of Waterloo
description: A professor of economics at the University of Waterloo in Canada, Larry Smith coaches his students to find the careers that they will truly love.

author: Latif Nasser
description: Latif Nasser is the director of research at Radiolab, where he has reported on such disparate topics as culture-bound illnesses, snowflake photography, sinking islands and 16th-century automata.

author: Lee Cronin
description: A professor of chemistry, nanoscience and chemical complexity, Lee Cronin and his research group investigate how chemistry can revolutionize modern technology and even create life.

author: Lee Smolin
description: Lee Smolin is a theoretical physicist, working mainly in the field of quantum gravity. He's a founding member of the Perimeter Institute for Theoretical Physics in Canada, and the author of The Trouble With Physics.

author: Lemn Sissay
description: An award-winning playwright and popular broadcaster in the UK, as well as the author of five poetry books, Lemn Sissay has a way with words.

author: Lemon Andersen
description: Lemon Andersen is a wordsmith who thinks deeply about the sounds of syllables.

author: Lennart Green
description: Cards that fly all over the table, spill onto the floor, and disappear beneath a laser beam. Welcome to the chaotic and flabbergasting magical world of Lennart Green, grand master of close-up card trickery.

author: Leonard Susskind
description: Leonard Susskind works on string theory, quantum field theory, quantum statistical mechanics and quantum cosmology at Stanford.

author: Lee Mokobe
description: Lee Mokobe is a 20-year-old South African slam poet and co-founder of Vocal Revolutionaries.

author: Lewis Pugh
description: Pushing his body through epic cold-water swims, Lewis Gordon Pugh wants to draw attention to our global climate. He's just back from swimming in a meltwater lake on the slopes of Mount Everest.

author: Lian Pin Koh
description: Lian Pin Koh expands conservation efforts by championing the use of low-cost autonomous aerial vehicles.

author: Liu Bolin
description: Beijing-based artist Liu Bolin silently comments on modern sociopolitical conditions by disappearing into his art.

author: Nicholas Stern
description: Lord Nicholas Stern studies the economics of climate change. He is a co-author of the position paper presented to the UN's 2014 Climate Summit, called "The New Climate Economy."

author: Louie Schwartzberg
description: Louie Schwartzberg is a cinematographer, director and producer who captures breathtaking images that celebrate life _ã revealing connections, universal rhythms, patterns and beauty.

author: Luca Turin
description: Biophysicist Luca Turin studies the science of smell. He's the author of Perfumes: The Guide, and the subject of Chandler Burr's 2003 book The Emperor of Scent. His next project: developing an artificial nose.

author: Lucien Engelen
description: Lucien Engelen is a technologist and innovator who is working to put patients into the healthcare team.

author: Ludwick Marishane
description: Student Ludwick Marishane invented a water-less bathing lotion and was named the 2011 Global Student Entrepreneur of the Year Award _ã all because he didn't feel like taking baths.

author: Luis von Ahn
description: Luis von Ahn builds systems that combine humans and computers to solve large-scale problems that neither can solve alone.

author: Luke Syson
description: As a curator at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Luke Syson accesses the richness of European history through sculpture.

author: LZ Granderson
description: CNN and ESPN columnist LZ Granderson is a celebrated voice on sports, race and gay rights.

author: Maajid Nawaz
description: Maajid Nawaz works to promote conversation, tolerance and democracy in Muslim and non-Muslim communities.

author: Mac Barnett
description: Mac Barnett is a bestselling author of books for children.

author: Mac Stone
description: Florida-based photographer Mac Stone specializes in documenting the Everglades, an area he prizes for its wildlife and flora.

author: Magnus Larsson
description: Magnus Larsson hopes to build new structures in the desert _ã  by using bacteria to turn shifting sand into a solid mass.

author: Malcolm Gladwell
description: Detective of fads and emerging subcultures, chronicler of jobs-you-never-knew-existed, Malcolm Gladwell's work is toppling the popular understanding of bias, crime, food, marketing, race, consumers and intelligence.

author: Malcolm London
description: Young spoken-word poet Malcolm London has been called the "Gil Scott-Heron of this generation" (by Cornel West). His feisty, passionate performances take on the issues of the day, including the Chicago education system in which he grew up.

author: Manu Prakash
description: Manu Prakash is on a mission to bring radical new technology to global health.

author: Manuel Lima
description: Manuel Lima studies how information can be organized _ã into elegant and beautiful diagrams that illustrate the many unexpected twists of big data.

author: Marc Abrahams
description: Marc Abrahams writes about research that makes people laugh, and then think.

author: Marc Goodman
description: Marc Goodman works to prevent future crimes and acts of terrorism, even those security threats not yet invented.

author: Marc Koska
description: Marc Koska wants to improve health care in the developing world by re-designing dangerous medical tools _ã and offering education to practitioners in under-funded clinics.

author: Marc Kushner
description: With Architizer, an online hub for architecture, Marc Kushner is breaking architecture out of its insular echo chamber and reconnecting the public with buildings.

author: Marc Pachter
description: Marc Pachter has spent his career curating and creating intimate portraits of the lives of others.

author: Marcel Dicke
description: Marcel Dicke wants us to reconsider our relationship with insects, promoting bugs as a tasty _ã and ecologically sound _ã alternative to meat in an increasingly hungry world.

author: Marcin Jakubowski
description: Marcin Jakubowski is open-sourcing a set of blueprints for 50 farming tools that can be built cheaply from scratch. Call it a "civilization starter kit."

author: Marco Annunziata
description: The Chief Economist at General Electric, Marco Annunziata is a financial virtuoso with a passion for technology.

author: Marco Tempest
description: A magician and illusionist for the 21st century, Marco Tempest blends cutting-edge technology with the flair and showmanship of Houdini.

author: Marcus du Sautoy
description: Oxford's newest science ambassador Marcus du Sautoy is also author of The Times' Sexy Maths column. He'll take you footballing with prime numbers, whopping symmetry groups, higher dimensions and other brow-furrowers.

author: Mark Applebaum
description: Mark Applebaum has built an instrument out of doorstops and combs, as well as composed a piece of music to be performed by a florist.

author: Mark Bezos
description: Mark Bezos works at Robin Hood, a poverty-fighting charity in New York City, and the assistant captain of a volunteer fire company in suburban New York.

author: Mark Bittman
description: Mark Bittman is a bestselling cookbook author, journalist and television personality. His friendly, informal approach to home cooking has shown millions that fancy execution is no substitute for flavor and soul.

author: Mark Forsyth
description: Mark Forsyth strolls through the English language, telling stories, making connections and banishing hobgoblins.

author: Mark Kendall
description: Mark Kendall aims to shake up how vaccines are delivered with the Nanopatch.

author: Mark Pagel
description: Using biological evolution as a template, Mark Pagel wonders how languages evolve.

author: Mark Plotkin
description: As fast as the rainforest is disappearing _ã the people of the rainforest are disappearing even faster. Mark Plotkin works to preserve generations of knowledge.

author: Mark Ronson
description: His production credits range from Amy Winehouse to Paul McCartney _ã ace DJ, musician and producer Mark Ronson has lived recent music history from the inside out.

author: Mark Shaw
description: Mark Shaw develops technologies to contain hazardous waste, storm water and radioactives.

author: Mark Z. Jacobson
description: At Stanford, Mark Z. Jacobson uses numerical models to study the effects of energy systems and vehicles on climate and air pollution, and to analyze renewable energy resources.

author: Markus Fischer
description: Markus Fischer led the team at Festo that developed the first ultralight artificial bird capable of flying like a real bird.

author: Martin Hanczyc
description: Martin Hanczyc explores the path between living and nonliving systems, using chemical droplets to study behavior of the earliest cells.

author: Martin Jacques
description: Martin Jacques is the author of "When China Rules the World," and a columnist for the Guardian and New Statesman. He was a co-founder of the think tank Demos.

author: Martin Pistorius
description: At age 12, Martin Pistorius fell into a coma, and spent 13 years locked inside his body, unable to communicate _ã until a caregiver noticed his eyes responded to her. His book "Ghost Boy" tells his story.

author: Martin Seligman
description: Martin Seligman is the founder of positive psychology, a field of study that examines healthy states, such as happiness, strength of character and optimism.

author: Martin Villeneuve
description: In his film "Mars et Avril," Martin Villeneuve brings his sci-fi romance graphic novel to glorious life.

author: Marvin Minsky
description: Marvin Minsky is one of the great pioneers of artificial intelligence _ã and using computing metaphors to understand the human mind. His contributions to mathematics, robotics and computational linguistics are legendary and far-reaching.

author: Mathieu Lehanneur
description: Kitchen-sized fish farms, living air purifiers and devices that turn old water bottles into martini shakers all spring from the form-and-function-fusing mind of designer Mathieu Lehanneur.

author: Matt Cutts
description: Matt Cutts is an engineer at Google, where he fights linkspam and helps webmasters understand how search works.

author: Matt Kenyon
description: From a plant that lives or dies based on stock prices to an oilcan that flows backward, Matt Kenyon creates art that startles, amuses and challenges assumptions.

author: Matt Killingsworth
description: Researcher Matt Killingsworth designs studies that gather data on happiness. One takeaway? "A Wandering Mind Is an Unhappy Mind."

author: Matt Ridley
description: Matt Ridley argues that, through history, the engine of human progress and prosperity has been, and is, "ideas having sex with each other."

author: Matthew Carter
description: Even if you don_ã_t recognize his name, chances are you_ã_ve seen Matthew Carter_ã_s work _ã his type designs include some of the world_ã_s most familiar digital typefaces.

author: Matthew Childs
description: Matthew Childs is an advertising lead at Razorfish. He is a lifelong rock climber and climbing guide.

author: Matthew Williams
occupation: Special Olympics International Sargent Shriver Global Messenger
description: Matthew Williams believes that sport has the power to change lives.

author: Matthieu Ricard
description: Sometimes called the "happiest man in the world," Matthieu Ricard is a Buddhist monk, author and photographer.

author: Maurizio Seracini
description: Maurizio Seracini uses advanced tools common in engineering and medical labs to unravel centuries-old mysteries of art.

author: Max Little
description: Max Little is a mathematician whose research includes a breakthrough technique to monitor _ã_ and potentially screen for _ã_ Parkinson's disease through simple voice recordings.

author: Eduardo Paes
description: Mayor Eduardo Paes is on a mission to ensure that Rio's renaissance creates a positive legacy for all its citizens.

author: Maz Jobrani
description: A founding member of the Axis of Evil Comedy Tour, Iranian-American comedian Maz Jobrani is now touring with his second solo comedy show, Browner and Friendlier.

author: Mechai Viravaidya
description: Since 1974, Mechai Viravaidya has been creating and running innovative family planning and poverty reduction programs throughout Southeast Asia.

author: Meron Gribetz
description: At Meta, Meron Gribetz is leading an effort to produce and sell augmented reality glasses with natural gestural hand recognition.

author: Michael Anti
description: Michael Anti (Zhao Jing), a key figure in China's new journalism, explores the growing power of the Chinese internet.

author: Mike Biddle
description: Discarded plastic, too often, ends up buried or burned, not recycled (it's just too complicated). But Mike Biddle has found a way to close the loop.

author: Michael Green
description: Michael Green wants to solve architecture_ã_s biggest challenge _ã meeting worldwide housing demand without increasing carbon emissions _ã by building with carbon-sequestering wood instead of concrete and steel.

author: Michael Hansmeyer
description: Michael Hansmeyer is an architect and programmer who explores the use of algorithms and computation to generate architectural form.

author: Michael Kimmel
description: The author of "Angry White Men," Michael Kimmel is a pre-eminent scholar of men and masculinity.

author: Michael McDaniel
description: Michael McDaniel is a graphic designer using his skills to help people in meaningful ways.

author: Michael Merzenich
description: Michael Merzenich studies neuroplasticity _ã the brain's powerful ability to change itself and adapt _ã and ways we might make use of that plasticity to heal injured brains and enhance the skills in healthy ones.

author: Michael Metcalfe
description: A senior managing director and head of global macro strategy at State Street Global Markets, Michael Metcalfe provides high quality capital flow research.

author: Michael Moschen
description: Quite simply, Michael Moschen has revolutionized juggling, refining it into an art and a bit of a science. With a few flying balls and well-chosen props he will completely re-wire your notions of the physically possible.

author: Michael Norton
description: Through clever studies, Michael Norton studies how we feel about what we buy and spend.

author: Michael Pawlyn
description: Michael Pawlyn takes cues from nature to make new, sustainable architectural environments.

author: Michael Pollan
description: Michael Pollan is the author of The Omnivore_ã_s Dilemma, in which he explains how our food not only affects our health but has far-reaching political, economic, and environmental implications. His new book is In Defense of Food.

author: Michael Porter
description: Michael E. Porter wrote the books on modern competitive strategy for business. Now he is thinking deeply about the intersection between society and corporate interests.

author: Michael Rubinstein
description: Computer scientist Michael Rubinstein and his team have developed a "motion microscope" that can show video footage of barely perceivable movements, like breaths and heartbeats.

author: Michael Sandel
description: Michael Sandel teaches political philosophy at Harvard, exploring some of the most hotly contested moral and political issues of our time.

author: Michael Shermer
description: Michael Shermer debunks myths, superstitions and urban legends _ã and explains why we believe them. Along with publishing Skeptic Magazine, he's author of Why People Believe Weird Things and The Mind of the Market.

author: Michael Specter
description: Michael Specter is a staff writer for the New Yorker. His new book, Denialism, asks why we have increasingly begun to fear scientific advances instead of embracing them.

author: Michael Tilson Thomas
description: Conductor Michael Tilson Thomas (call him MTT) is an all-around music educator _ã connecting with global audiences, young musicians and concertgoers in San Francisco and London.

author: Michel Laberge
description: In a lab near Vancouver, Michel Laberge and his team at General Fusion are building a prototype fusion reactor that mimics the processes of the sun to produce cheap, clean and abundant energy.

author: Mick Cornett
description: Mick Cornett is mayor of Oklahoma City, OK.

author: Mick Ebeling
description: Mick Ebeling founded the Not Impossible Foundation, a nonprofit that develops creative solutions to real-world problems.

author: Mick Mountz
description: Mick Mountz is the founder and CEO of Kiva Systems, making high-tech products for fast, cheap and efficient inventory fulfillment. In March 2012, Kiva was acquired by Amazon.

author: Miguel Nicolelis
description: Miguel Nicolelis explores the limits of the brain-machine interface.

author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi
description: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi has contributed pioneering work to our understanding of happiness, creativity, human fulfillment and the notion of "flow" _ã a state of heightened focus and immersion in activities such as art, play and work.

author: Mike deGruy
description: Mike deGruy filmed in and on the ocean for more than three decades _ã becoming almost as famous for his storytelling as for his glorious, intimate visions of the sea and the creatures who live in it.

author: Mike Matas
description: While at Apple, Mike Matas helped write the user interface for the iPhone and iPad. Now with Push Pop Press, he's helping to rewrite the electronic book.

author: Mike Rowe
description: Mike Rowe is the host of "Dirty Jobs" _ã an incredibly entertaining and heartfelt tribute to hard labor.

author: Mike Velings
description: Mike Velings understands the potential for business to create durable solutions to complex world problems.

author: Mikko Hypponen
description: As computer access expands, Mikko Hypponen asks: What's the next killer virus, and will the world be able to cope with it? And also: How can we protect digital privacy in the age of government surveillance?

author: Milton Glaser
description: If his career began and ended with "I [heart] N Y," Milton Glaser would still be a legend. But over his multi-decade career, his body of work is sprinkled with similarly iconic images and logos.

author: Misha Glenny
description: Journalist Misha Glenny leaves no stone unturned (and no failed state unexamined) in his excavation of criminal globalization.

author: Mitch Resnick
description: Mitch Resnick directs the Lifelong Kindergarten group at MIT Media Lab, dedicated to helping kids of all ages tinker and experiment with design.

author: Mitchell Joachim
description: Soft cars, jet packs and houses made of meat are all in a day's work for urban designer, architect and TED Fellow Mitchell Joachim.

author: Mohamed Ali
description: Human rights advocate Mohamed Ali fights terrorism with entrepreneurship.

author: Mohamed Hijri
description: Mohamed Hijri studies arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi (AMF), seeking to understand the structure, evolution and reproduction of these organisms, which form a symbiotic relationship with plant roots.

author: Moran Cerf
description: Moran Cerf studies the underlying mechanisms of our psychology by eavesdropping on the activity of our brain from the inside out.

author: Morgan Spurlock
description: Morgan Spurlock makes documentary film and TV that is personal, political _ã and, above all, deeply empathetic.

author: Moshe Safdie
description: Moshe Safdie's buildings _ã from grand libraries to intimate apartment complexes _ã explore the qualities of light and the nature of private and public space.

author: Mundano
description: Mundano's bold, colorful street art isn't just eye candy. His projects call attention to social, environmental and political issues, while raising chuckles from passersby.

author: Munir Virani
description: Munir Virani is a raptor biologist and wildlife photographer, and Director of the Peregrine Fund Africa Program, devoted to conserving birds of prey.

author: Murray Gell-Mann
description: Murray Gell-Mann brings visibility to a crucial aspect of our existence that we can't actually see: elemental particles. He won the Nobel Prize in Physics for introducing quarks, one of two fundamental ingredients for all matter in the universe.

author: Mustafa Akyol
description: Mustafa Akyol is a columnist for Turkey's oldest English-language daily, Hurriyet Daily News.

author: Nanê Vasconcelos
description: A jazz icon since the late 1960s, Nanê Vasconcelos contributed Latin percussion to some of the world_ã_s most cerebral, soulful music.

author: Nandan Nilekani
description: Nandan Nilekani is the author of "Imagining India," a radical re-thinking of one of the world_ã_s great economies. The co-founder of Infosys, he helped move India into the age of IT.

author: Nate Silver
description: Math whiz and baseball fan Nate Silver was mainly known for predicting outcomes in fantasy ballgames _ã until his technique hit a home run calling the outcome of the 2008 election primaries.

author: Nathaniel Kahn
description: Nathaniel Kahn is an Oscar- and Emmy-nominated maker of documentary films. His journey to understand his distant father _ã the legendary modern architect Louis Kahn _ã became the film "My Architect."

author: Navi Radjou
