description: Drawing inspiration from frugal innovators in emerging markets, Navi Radjou helps businesses with limited resources discover unexpected ways to succeed.

author: Neil Burgess
description: At University College in London, Neil Burgess researches how patterns of electrical activity in brain cells guide us through space.

author: Neil Harbisson
description: Neil Harbisson's "eyeborg" allows him to hear colors, even those beyond the range of sight.

author: Neil MacGregor
description: The writer and presenter of the BBC Radio 4 series "A History of the World in 100 Objects" and the accompanying book.

author: Neil Pasricha
occupation: Director, The Institute for Global Happiness
description: Neil Pasricha is the New York Times bestselling author of The Happiness Equation and serves as the Director of the Institute for Global Happiness after a decade running leadership development inside Walmart. He is one the world's leading authorities on happiness and positivity.

author: Neil Turok
description: Neil Turok is working on a model of the universe that explains the big bang _ã while, closer to home, he's founded a network of math and science academies across Africa.

author: Newton Aduaka
description: Newton Aduaka's award-winning Ezra, told through the eyes of a young boy in Sierra Leone, illuminates one of the most harrowing consequences of war: the recruitment of child soldiers.

author: Niall Ferguson
description: History is a curious thing, and Niall Ferguson investigates not only what happened but why. (Hint: Politics and money explain a lot.)

author: Nic Marks
description: Nic Marks gathers evidence about what makes us happy, and uses it to promote policy that puts the well-being of people and the planet first. He's the founder of the Centre for Well-Being at the UK think tank New Economics Foundation (NEF).

author: Nicholas Christakis
description: Nicholas Christakis explores how the large-scale, face-to-face social networks in which we are embedded affect our lives, and what we can do to take advantage of this fact.

author: Nicholas Negroponte
description: The founder of the MIT Media Lab, Nicholas Negroponte pushed the edge of the information revolution as an inventor, thinker and angel investor. He's the driving force behind One Laptop per Child, building computers for children in the developing world.

author: Nicolas Perony
description: Nicolas Perony models the movement of animal groups to understand: what is the individual behavior that guides the behavior of the larger society?

author: Nick Bostrom
description: Nick Bostrom asks big questions: What should we do, as individuals and as a species, to optimize our long-term prospects? Will humanity_ã_s technological advancements ultimately destroy us?

author: Nick Hanauer
description: Nick Hanauer has become an important voice in the raging debate on inequality _ã and his provocative argument is aimed at his fellow plutocrats.

author: Nick Sears
description: Working with his father, Ron Sears, Nick Sears is designing and building the Orb, a rotating LED display that uses persistence of vision to produce moving images in 3D space.

author: Niels Diffrient
description: Design legend Niels Diffrient is the creator of the Freedom Chair, a radical rethink of the way we sit today. Throughout his career, he's been a pioneer of ergonomic design _ã studying the human body (in all its shapes and sizes) and how to make it comfortable.

author: Nigel Marsh
description: Nigel Marsh presents and writes on business and personal life _ã and how the two interact. He is the author of "Fat, Forty and Fired."

author: Nikolai Begg
description: Nikolai Begg is a PhD candidate in mechanical engineering whose passion is rethinking medical devices.

author: Nirmalya Kumar
description: Nirmalya Kumar is a professor of Marketing at the London Business School and a passionate voice for new entrepreneurs in India.

author: Nizar Ibrahim
description: Nizar Ibrahim scours Northern Africa for clues to what things were like there in the Cretaceous period. A 2015 TED Fellow, he has spearheaded the recent search for the semi-aquatic dinosaur Spinosaurus.

author: Noah Feldman
description: Noah Feldman studies the intersection of religion, politics and law _ã with a focus on how Islam meshes with modern democracy.

author: Norman Foster
description: Sir Norman Foster, winner of the 1999 Pritzker Prize, is perhaps the leading urban stylist of our age. His elegant, efficient buildings grace cities around the globe.

author: Ola Rosling
description: Ola Rosling is the director and co-founder of the Gapminder Foundation. Previously, he was the Google Public Data product manager.

author: Olafur Eliasson
description: The transparent simplicity and experiential nature of his work has built Olafur Eliasson's reputation as one of the world's most accessible creators of contemporary art.

author: Ole Scheeren
description: Ole Scheeren designs buildings that generate both functional and social spaces.

author: Oliver Sacks
description: Since "Awakenings" stormed the bestseller lists (and the silver screen), Oliver Sacks has become an unlikely household name, single-handedly inventing the genre of neurological anthropology.

author: Omar Ahmad
description: An internet infrastructure maven and activist, Omar Ahmad was the mayor of San Carlos, California.

author: Onyx Ashanti
description: Onyx Ashanti is the inventor of "beatjazz" _ã a new way to make music.

author: Oscar Schwartz
description: Oscar Schwartz's research and writing concerns the influence of digital technology on culture and human interaction.

author: P.W. Singer
description: In P.W. Singer's most recent book, "Wired for War," he studies robotic and drone warfighters _ã and explores how these new war machines are changing the very nature of human conflict. He has also written on other facets of modern war, including private armies and child soldiers.

author: Paddy Ashdown
description: Paddy Ashdown is a former member of the British Parliament and a diplomat with a lifelong commitment to international cooperation.

author: Pankaj Ghemawat
description: Our world is not flat, says ecnomist Pankaj Ghemawat _ã it's at best semi-globalized, with limited interactions between countries and economies.

author: Parag Khanna
description: Geopolitical futurist Parag Khanna foresees a world in which megacities, supply chains and connective technologies redraw the map away from states and borders.

author: Patrick Awuah
description: After working at Microsoft for almost a decade, Patrick Awuah returned home to Ghana and cofounded Ashesi University, a small liberal arts college that aims to educate Africa's next generation of leaders. Its first class of students graduated in 2006.

author: Patrick Chappatte
description: Using clean, simple pencil strokes, editorial cartoonist Patrick Chappatte wields globally literate and to-the-point humor on world events _ã the tragic, the farcical and the absurd.

author: Paul Bennett
description: As a creative director at Ideo, Paul Bennett reminds us that design need not invoke grand gestures or sweeping statements to be successful, but instead can focus on the little things in life, the obvious, the overlooked.

author: Paul Bloom
description: Paul Bloom explores some of the most puzzling aspects of human nature, including pleasure, religion, and morality.

author: Paul Collier
description: Paul Collier_ã_s book The Bottom Billion shows what is happening to the poorest people in the world, and offers ideas for opening up opportunities to all.

author: Paul Conneally
description: Paul Conneally is the public communications manager for the International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, and a leader in using digital technologies for humanitarian aid.

author: Paul Debevec
description: Paul Debevec's digital inventions have powered the breathtaking visual effects in films like The Matrix, Superman Returns, King Kong and The Curious Case of Benjamin Button.

author: Paul Ewald
description: After years of studying illness from the germs' point of view, microbiologist Paul Ewald believes that Big Pharma is wrong about some very big issues. What's right? The leader in evolutionary medicine posits radical new approaches.

author: Paul Gilding
description: Paul Gilding is an independent writer, activist and adviser on a sustainable economy. Click through to watch the onstage debate that followed this talk.

author: Paul Greenberg
description: Paul Greenberg researches and writes about fish, aquaculture and the future of the ocean.

author: Paul Kemp-Robertson
description: Paul Kemp-Robertson is the Cofounder and Editorial Director of Contagious Communications, a multi-platform marketing resource.

author: Paul MacCready
description: Paul MacCready, an aircraft designer and environmentalist, is a pioneer of human-powered flight, alternative energy for transportation, and environmentally responsible design.

author: Paul Moller
description: With a team of engineers, Paul Moller works on the Skycar, a combination car and jet, as well as the M200, a saucer-shaped hovering car. He also develops next-generation engines to power these and other amazing vehicles.

author: Paul Nicklen
description: Paul Nicklen photographs the creatures of the Arctic and Antarctic, generating global awareness about wildlife in these isolated and endangered environments.

author: Paul Piff
description: Paul Piff studies how social hierarchy, inequality and emotion shape relations between individuals and groups.

author: Paul Romer
description: Paul Romer is developing a radical new model of growth and governance, which calls for the establishment of city-scale special administrative zones.

author: Paul Root Wolpe
description: Paul Root Wolpe examines the ethical implications of new science _ã genetic modification, neuroscience and other breakthroughs that stretch our current philosophy to the breaking point. He's the chief bioethicist at NASA, among other appointments.

author: Paul Rothemund
description: Paul Rothemund folds DNA into shapes and patterns. Which is a simple enough thing to say, but the process he has developed has vast implications for computing and manufacturing _ã allowing us to create things we can now only dream of.

author: Paul Sereno
description: Surely not the only science career based on a museum tour epiphany, Paul Sereno's is almost certainly the most triumphant. He's dug up dinosaurs on five continents _ã and discovered the world's largest crocodile, the (extinct) 40-foot Sarchosuchus.

author: Paul Snelgrove
description: Paul Snelgrove led the group that pulled together the findings of the Census of Marine Life _ã synthesizing 10 years and 540 expeditions into a book of wonders.

author: Paul Stamets
description: Paul Stamets believes that mushrooms can save our lives, restore our ecosystems and transform other worlds.

author: Paul Tudor Jones II
description: Paul Jones is founder of Tudor Investment Corporation and an active philanthropist.

author: Paul Zak
description: A pioneer in the field of neuroeconomics, Paul Zak is uncovering how the hormone oxytocin promotes trust, and proving that love is good for business.

author: Pavan Sukhdev
description: A banker by training, Pavan Sukhdev runs the numbers on greening up _ã showing that green economies are an effective engine for creating jobs and creating wealth.

author: Pete Alcorn
description: Pete Alcorn is the head of podcasting for Apple, and a veteran of the paper-publishing industry.

author: Peter Attia
description: Both a surgeon and a self-experimenter, Peter Attia hopes to ease the diabetes epidemic by challenging what we think we know and improving the scientific rigor in nutrition and obesity research.

author: Peter Diamandis
description: Peter Diamandis runs the X Prize Foundation, which offers large cash incentive prizes to inventors who can solve grand challenges like space flight, low-cost mobile medical diagnostics and oil spill cleanup. He is the chair of Singularity University, which teaches executives and grad students about exponentially growing technologies.

author: Peter Donnelly
description: Peter Donnelly is an expert in probability theory who applies statistical methods to genetic data _ã spurring advances in disease treatment and insight on our evolution. He's also an expert on DNA analysis, and an advocate for sensible statistical analysis in the courtroom.

author: Peter Doolittle
description: Peter Doolittle is striving to understand the processes of human learning.

author: Peter Eigen
description: As a director of the World Bank in Nairobi, Peter Eigen saw firsthand how devastating corruption can be. He's founder of Transparency International, an NGO that works to persuade international companies not to bribe.

author: Pê©ter Fankhauser
description: Pê©ter Fankhauser is the leader of a team of students working on Rezero, a robot that balances on a single sphere.

author: Peter Gabriel
description: Peter Gabriel writes incredible songs but, as the co-founder of WITNESS and TheElders.org, is also a powerful human rights advocate.

author: Peter Haas
description: Inveterate tinkerer Peter Haas is the co-founder of AIDG, the Appropriate Infrastructure Development Group, which connect people to electricity, sanitation and clean water through a combination of business incubation, education, and outreach.

author: Peter Hirshberg
description: A Silicon Valley executive, entrepreneur and marketing specialist, Peter Hirshberg might just be the definitive voice on how new technology affects business and culture.

author: Peter Molyneux
description: The head of Microsoft's European games division, Peter Molyneux is building an astonishing new "virtual friend" who interacts with you.

author: Peter Norvig
description: Peter Norvig is a leading American computer scientist, expert on artificial intelligence and the Director of Research at Google Inc.

author: Peter Reinhart
description: Master breadmaker Peter Reinhart is also a teacher, author and theologian. Through his lectures and numerous cookbooks, he channels the science of baking into deep, spiritual lessons _ã and dispels stale myths about the nature (and flavor) of good, wholesome bread.

author: Peter Saul
description: Over the past 35 years Peter Saul has been intimately involved in the dying process for over 4,000 patients. He is passionate about improving the ways we die.

author: Peter Singer
description: Sometimes controversial, always practical ethicist Peter Singer stirs public debate about morality, from animal welfare to global poverty.

author: Peter Tyack
description: Peter Tyack studies the social behavior and acoustic communication in whales and dolphins, learning how these animals use sound to perform critical activities, such as mating and locating food.

author: Peter van Uhm
description: General Peter van Uhm is the Chief of the Netherlands Defence staff.

author: Peter Ward
description: Peter D. Ward studies life on Earth _ã where it came from, how it might end, and how utterly rare it might be.

author: Phil Hansen
description: Taking a cue from his own artistic journey, Phil Hansen challenges us to spark our creativity by thinking inside the box.

author: Phil Plait
description: Phil Plait blogs at Bad Astronomy, where he deconstructs misconceptions and explores the wonder of the universe.

author: Philip K. Howard
description: Philip K. Howard is the founder of Common Good, a drive to overhaul the US legal system. His new book is 'The Rule of Nobody.'

author: Philip Rosedale
description: Philip Rosedale (avatar "Philip Linden") is founder of Second Life, an online 3D virtual world inhabited by millions. He's chair of Linden Labs, the company behind the digital society.

author: Philip Zimbardo
description: Philip Zimbardo was the leader of the notorious 1971 Stanford Prison Experiment _ã and an expert witness at Abu Ghraib. His book The Lucifer Effect explores the nature of evil; now, in his new work, he studies the nature of heroism.

author: Philippe Petit
description: High-wire artist Philippe Petit surprised the world when he walked illegally between the Twin Towers in 1974.

author: Philippe Starck
description: Philippe Starck designs deluxe objects and posh condos and hotels around the world. Always witty and engaged, he takes special delight in rethinking everyday objects.

author: Pico Iyer
description: Pico Iyer_ã_s travel writing chronicles fascinating (and often jarring) examples of cultural mashups. Now he shows how travel can rescue us from our technological distractions.

author: Pranav Mistry
occupation: Director of research, Samsung Research America
description: As an MIT grad student, Pranav Mistry invented SixthSense, a wearable device that enables new interactions between the real world and the world of data.

author: Preston Reed
description: Preston Reed_ã_s hands have an otherworldly coordination. The fingers, nails, thumbs, and palms of both left and right dance, pluck, strum, and slap his guitar, which bursts with a full sound.

author: R.A. Mashelkar
description: Using a principle he calls _ãconvex lens leadership,_ã R.A. Mashelkar_ã_s vision has catapulted india_ã_s talent for science and innovation onto the international stage.

author: R. Luke DuBois
description: R. Luke DuBois weaves information from a multitude of sources into art and music exploring the tensions between algorithms, portraiture and temporal space.

author: Raffaello D'Andrea
description: Raffaello D'Andrea explores the possibilities of autonomous technology by collaborating with artists, engineers and entrepreneurs.

author: Rainer Strack
description: BCG's Rainer Strack advocates for companies to adopt a "people advantage" _ã because employee-centered thinking can go a long way.

author: Rajesh Rao
description: Rajesh Rao seeks to understand the human brain through computational modeling, on two fronts: developing computer models of our minds, and using tech to decipher the 4,000-year-old lost script of the Indus Valley civilization.

author: Rajiv Maheswaran
description: Using advanced data analysis tools, Rajiv Maheswaran and Second Spectrum help make basketball teams smarter.

author: Ralph Langner
description: Ralph Langner is a German control system security consultant. He has received worldwide recognition for his analysis of the Stuxnet malware.

author: Ramanan Laxminarayan
description: At the Center for Disease Dynamics, Economics & Policy, economist Ramanan Laxminarayan looks at big-picture issues of global health.

author: Ramsey Musallam
description: As a high school chemistry teacher, Ramsey Musallam expands curiosity in the classroom through multimedia and new technology.

author: Randall Munroe
description: Randall Munroe sketches elegant and illuminating explanations of the weird science and math questions that keep geeks awake at night.

author: Raul Midon
description: Guitarist and singer Raul Midon blends flamenco, jazz and R&B to create a category-defying sound. His life story is as inspiring as his musical vision.

author: Thulasiraj Ravilla
description: Thulasiraj Ravilla is the executive director of the Lions Aravind Institute of Community Ophthalmology, helping eye-care hospitals around the world build capacity to prevent blindness.

author: Ravin Agrawal
description: As an emerging markets investor, Ravin Agrawal tries to predict the future, balancing economic, political and technological factors.

author: Ray Anderson
description: Ray Anderson founded the company that makes covetable Flor carpeting. But behind the fresh design is a decades-deep commitment to sustainable ways of doing business _ã culminating in the Mission Zero plan.

author: Ray Kurzweil
description: Ray Kurzweil is an engineer who has radically advanced the fields of speech, text and audio technology. He's revered for his dizzying _ã yet convincing _ã writing on the advance of technology, the limits of biology and the future of the human species.

author: Ray Zahab
description: In January 2009, Ray Zahab broke the record for fastest unsupported trek across Antarctica, to raise awareness and money for kids' environmental education. In 2006, he ran across the Sahara to raise awareness of water shortages. (He started running 5 years ago.)

author: Raymond Wang
description: Raymond Wang won the top prize in the 2015 Intel Science and Engineering Fair for his invention that circulates fresh air on planes and reduces transmission of germs between passengers.

author: Read Montague
description: What does "normal behavior" look like? To find out, Read Montague is imaging thousands of brains at work.

author: Reed Kroloff
description: With an outspoken approach to the problems of rebuilding cites and a fearless eye for design, Reed Kroloff is helping to change the urban landscape of cities from New York to New Orleans.

author: Reggie Watts
description: Reggie Watts creates unpredictably brilliant performances on the spot using his voice, looping pedals and his giant brain.

author: Renny Gleeson
description: Renny Gleeson helps navigate brands through fresh concepts, such as viral marketing and social media, to find the pulse of the modern consumer.

author: Reuben Margolin
description: Reuben Margolin's moving sculptures combine the logic of math with the sensuousness of nature.

author: Jeffrey Brown
description: A key player in the "Boston miracle" that lowered the rate of youth crime and gang violence, Rev. Jeffrey Brown is a Baptist minister.

author: Tom Honey
description: The Vicar of St David's Church, Exeter, in the UK, is unafraid to take on some of religion's tougher issues.

author: Ric Elias
description: Ric Elias is the CEO of Red Ventures, a marketing services company that grew out of Elias' long experience in business.

author: Riccardo Sabatini
description: Riccardo Sabatini applies his expertise in numerical modeling and data to projects ranging from material science to computational genomics and food market predictions.

author: Rich Benjamin
description: The author of "Whitopia," Rich Benjamin sharply observes modern society and politics.

author: Richard Branson
description: Richard Branson bootstrapped his way from record-shop owner to head of the Virgin empire. Now he's focusing his boundless energy on saving our environment.

author: Richard Dawkins
description: Oxford professor Richard Dawkins has helped steer evolutionary science into the 21st century, and his concept of the "meme" contextualized the spread of ideas in the information age. In recent years, his devastating critique of religion has made him a leading figure in the New Atheism.

author: Richard Preston
description: Richard Preston wrote The Hot Zone, a classic look at the Ebola virus and the scientists who fight it. His wide-ranging curiosity about science and people has led him to cover a dizzying list of topics, with a lapidary attention to detail and an ear for the human voice.

author: Richard Pyle
description: Ichthyologist Richard Pyle is a fish nerd. In his quest to discover and document new species of fish, he has also become a trailblazing exploratory diver and a pioneer of database technology.

author: Richard Resnick
description: Richard Resnick is on the front lines of the business of genomes, as CEO of GenomeQuest, a maker of genomic software.

author: Richard Sears
description: Richard Sears thinks hard about the post-oil world. He's a visiting scientist at MIT, after a long career as a VP at Shell.

author: Richard St. John
description: A self-described average guy who found success doing what he loved, Richard St. John spent more than a decade researching the lessons of success _ã and distilling them into 8 words, 3 minutes and one successful book.

author: Richard Turere
description: Young inventor Richard Turere invented "lion lights," an elegant way to protect his family's cattle from lion attacks.

author: Richard Weller
description: Dermatologist Richard Weller wants to know: Why are Scots so sick?

author: Richard Wilkinson
description: In "The Spirit Level," Richard Wilkinson charts data that proves societies that are more equal are healthier, happier societies.

author: Richard Ledgett
description: Richard Ledgett is deputy director and senior civilian leader of the National Security Agency. He acts as the agency_ã_s chief operating officer, responsible for guiding and directing studies, operations and policy.

author: Rick Smolan
description: Rick Smolan is the co-founder of the America 24/7 and Day in the Life photography series _ã and a natural storyteller in many media. His latest books are America at Home and Blue Planet Run.

author: Rick Warren
description: Pastor Rick Warren is the author of The Purpose-Driven Life, which has sold more than 30 million copies worldwide. His has become an immensely influential voice seeking to apply the values of his faith to issues such as global poverty, HIV/AIDS and injustice.

author: Rishi Manchanda
description: Rishi Manchanda is an "upstreamist." A physician and public health innovator, he aims to reinvigorate primary care by teaching doctors to think about_ãand treat_ãthe social and environmental conditions that often underly sickness.

author: Rives
description: Performance artist and storyteller Rives has been called "the first 2.0 poet," using images, video and technology to bring his words to life.

author: Rob Dunbar
description: Rob Dunbar looks deeply at ancient corals and sediments to study how the climate and the oceans have shifted over the past 50 to 12,000 years _ã and how the Antarctic ecosystem is changing right now.

author: Rob Forbes
description: Rob Forbes founded Design Within Reach, the furniture company that brought high design to the general public.

author: Rob Harmon
description: Rob Harmon is an expert on energy and natural resources policy _ã looking at smart ways to manage carbon, water and the energy we use every day.

author: Rob Hopkins
description: Rob Hopkins is the founder of the Transition movement, a radically hopeful and community-driven approach to creating societies independent of fossil fuel.

author: Rob Knight
description: Rob Knight explores the unseen microbial world that exists literally right under our noses _ã and everywhere else on (and in) our bodies.

author: Rob Reid
description: Rob Reid is a humor author and the founder of the company that created the music subscription service Rhapsody.

author: Robert Ballard
description: On more than 120 deep-sea expeditions, Robert Ballard has made many major natural discoveries, such as the deep-sea vents. Oh, and he found the Titanic.

author: Robert Fischell
description: Robert Fischell invented the rechargeable pacemaker, the implantable insulin pump, and devices that warn of epileptic seizures and heart attacks. Yet it's not just his inventive genius that makes him fascinating, but his determination to make the world a better place.

author: Robert Full
description: Robert Full studies cockroach legs and gecko feet. His research is helping build tomorrow's robots, based on evolution's ancient engineering.

author: Robert Gupta
description: Violinist Robert Gupta joined the LA Philharmonic at the age of 19 _ã and maintains a passionate parallel interest in neurobiology and mental health issues. He's a TED Senior Fellow.

author: Robert Hammond
description: The co-founder of Friends of the High Line, Robert Hammond helped lead the effort to build an elevated park on an abandoned railway line in Manhattan.

author: Robert J. Gordon
description: Robert J. Gordon is among the most influential macroeconomists in the world. And the big picture he sees is not altogether rosy.

author: Robert Lang
description: Robert Lang merges mathematics with aesthetics to fold elegant modern origami. His scientific approach helps him make folds once thought impossible _ã and has secured his place as one of the first great Western masters of the art.

author: Robert Lee Hotz
description: Robert Lee Hotz is the science columnist for the Wall Street Journal, where he writes about cutting-edge research on climate change, cosmology, molecular medicine, the human brain and much more ... He has traveled three times to the South Pole.

author: Rob Legato
description: Rob Legato creates surprising and creative visual illusions for movies.

author: Robert Neuwirth
description: To research his new book, "Stealth of Nations," Robert Neuwirth spent four years among street vendors, smugglers and _ãinformal_ã import/export firms.

author: Robert Palmer
description: Robert Palmer investigates how the financial system facilitates corruption and other crimes.

author: Robert Swan
description: Robert Swan has explored both poles, and wants to make sure that Antarctica, the world's last great wilderness, is never exploited.

author: Robert Waldinger
description: Robert Waldinger is the Director of the Harvard Study of Adult Development, one of the most comprehensive longitudinal studies in history.

author: Robert Wright
description: The best-selling author of "Nonzero," "The Moral Animal" and "The Evolution of God," Robert Wright draws on his wide-ranging knowledge of science, religion, psychology, history and politics to figure out what makes humanity tick _ã and what makes us moral.

author: Robin Ince
description: The rational-minded Robin Ince conducts live experiments in comedy.

author: Rodney Brooks
description: Rodney Brooks builds robots based on biological principles of movement and reasoning. The goal: a robot who can figure things out.

author: Rodney Mullen
description: Rodney Mullen is a legendary skateboarder who transformed the art of street skating.

author: Rodrigo Bijou
description: Rodrigo Bijou's work focuses on the cross section of intelligence, data science and information security.

author: Rodrigo Canales
description: Rodrigo Canales wants to understand how individuals influence organizations or systems_ãeven those as complex as the Mexican drug cartels.

author: Roger Ebert
description: After losing the power to speak, legendary film critic Roger Ebert went on to write about creativity, race, politics and culture _ã and film, just as brilliantly as ever.

author: Roger Stein
description: Roger Stein wants to bring financial engineering to the world of drug funding.

author: Rogier van der Heide
description: Rogier van der Heide creates architectural spaces with light.

author: Roman Mars
description: With his show 99% Invisible, Roman Mars discovered new ways to jolt public radio out of its old paradigms, while at the same time spinning riveting tales of design.

author: Romulus Whitaker
description: Romulus Whitaker is a scientist and conservationist who slings around the globe to study and protect reptiles.

author: Ron Finley
description: Ron Finley grows a nourishing food culture in South Central L.A._ã_s food desert by planting the seeds and tools for healthy eating.

author: Ron Gutman
description: Ron Gutman is the founder and CEO of HealthTap, free mobile and online apps for health info. He's also the organizer of TEDxSiliconValley.

author: Ron McCallum
description: Blind almost since birth, Ron McCallum is one of Australia's most respected legal scholars, and an activist on behalf of disabled people around the globe.

author: Ronny Edry
description: Ronny Edry of Israel created The Peace Factory, an online movement for peace in the Middle East, when he posted a Facebook image that declared "Iranians, we will never bomb your country."

author: Rory Bremner
description: One of the UK's sharpest funny men, Rory Bremner exposes the lunacies of modern politics with devilishly clever political satire and spot-on impressions of leaders from around the world.

author: Rory Stewart
description: Rory Stewart _ã a perpetual pedestrian, a diplomat, an adventurer and an author _ã is the member of British Parliament for Penrith and the Border.

author: Rory Sutherland
description: Rory Sutherland stands at the center of an advertising revolution in brand identities, designing cutting-edge, interactive campaigns that blur the line between ad and entertainment.

author: Ross Lovegrove
description: Known as "Captain Organic," Ross Lovegrove embraces nature as the inspiration for his "fat-free" design. Each object he creates _ã be it bottle, chair, staircase or car _ã is reduced to its essential elements. His pieces offer minimal forms of maximum beauty.

author: Roy Gould
description: A researcher at the Harvard Center for Astrophysics, Roy Gould gives the first public demo of the World Wide Telescope, a powerful new web-based tool for exploring the universe, developed by TEDster Curtis Wong and his team at Microsoft.

author: Rufus Cappadocia
description: Globe-trotting, genre-hopping cellist Rufus Cappadocia plays the music of our sphere.

author: Russ Altman
description: Russ Altman uses machine learning to better understand adverse effects of medication.

author: Russell Foster
description: Russell Foster studies sleep and its role in our lives, examining how our perception of light influences our sleep-wake rhythms.

author: Ryan Holladay
description: With his brother, Hays, Ryan Holladay creates site-specific sound installations, interactive concerts and GPS-based compositions for sites across the United States.

author: Ryan Lobo
description: As a photographer and filmmaker, Ryan Lobo uses his exquisite lens to capture humanity and nature at their most open and vulnerable moments.

author: Ryan Merkley
description: Ryan Merkley is the Chief Operating Officer at the Mozilla Foundation, and is dedicated to making the web a more user-friendly place.

author: Saki Mafundikwa
description: Saki Mafundikwa wrote the book on Africa_ã_s graphic design heritage _ã then opened a school of graphic arts in his native Zimbabwe.

author: Salman Khan
description: In 2004, Salman Khan, a hedge fund analyst, began posting math tutorials on YouTube. Six years later, he has posted more than 2,000 tutorials, which are viewed nearly 100,000 times around the world each day.

author: Sam Harris
description: In Sam Harris' best-selling books, he suggests that questioning religious faith might just save civilization.

author: Sam Martin
description: Sam Martin is the director of digital strategy at Texas Monthly magazine, and the author of "Manspace: A Primal Guide to Marking Your Territory."

author: Sam Richards
description: Sam Richards is a sociologist and teacher of the largest race relations course in the US. He argues that empathy is the core of sociology.

author: Samuel Cohen
description: Samuel Cohen researches Alzheimer's disease and other neurodegenerative disorders.

author: Sanford Biggers
description: Sanford Biggers creates art that upends traditional narratives about topics ranging from hip hop to Buddhism to American history.

author: Sangu Delle
description: Sangu Delle is an entrepreneur and clean water activist. A TED Fellow who hails from Ghana, he sees incredible potential in the African economy.

author: Sanjay Dastoor
description: Sanjay Dastoor is the co-founder of Boosted Boards, a startup that aims to build the world's lightest electric vehicles.

author: Sanjay Pradhan
description: Sanjay Pradhan is vice president of the World Bank Institute, helping leaders in developing countries learn skills for reform, development and good governance.

author: Sasa Vucinic
description: Sasa Vucinic's Media Development Loan Fund applies venture-capital principles to create a sustainable free press in developing nations and countries emerging from repressive regimes.

author: Saul Griffith
description: Inventor Saul Griffith looks for elegant ways to make real things, from low-cost eyeglasses to a kite that tows boats. His latest projects include open-source inventions and elegant new ways to generate power.

author: Scott Dinsmore
description: Scott Dinsmore founded Live Your Legend, a career and connection platform to inspire people to find their passion.

author: Scott Fraser
description: Scott Fraser is a forensic psychologist who thinks deeply about the fallibility of human memory and encourages a more scientific approach to trial evidence.

author: Scott Kim
description: Scott Kim designs puzzles in the spirit of MC Escher's art and Tetris _ã visually stimulating, thought provoking and suffused with broad appeal.

author: Scott McCloud
description: Scott McCloud is author of Understanding Comics, a comic book about comics. He's an evangelist for comics as a valid literary form (as more than pulp and kids' stuff) and his admiring fans include a laundry list of superstar cartoonists.

author: Sean Carroll
description: A physicist, cosmologist and gifted science communicator, Sean Carroll is asking himself _ã and asking us to consider _ã questions that get at the fundamental nature of the universe.

author: Sean Follmer
description: Sean Follmer designs shape-changing and deformable interfaces that take advantage of our natural dexterity and spatial abilities.

author: Sean Gourley
description: Sean Gourley, trained as a physicist, has turned his scientific mind to analyzing data about a messier topic: modern war and conflict. He is a TED Fellow.

author: Sebastian Deterding
description: Sebastian Deterding is an interface designer who thinks deeply about persuasive and gameful design.

author: Sebastian Junger
description: The author of "The Perfect Storm" and the director of the documentaries "Restrepo" and "Korengal," Sebastian Junger tells non-fiction stories with grit and emotion.

author: Sebastian Seung
description: Sebastian Seung is a leader in the new field of connectomics, currently the hottest space in neuroscience, which studies, in once-impossible detail, the wiring of the brain.

author: Sebastian Thrun
description: Sebastian Thrun is the director of the Stanford Artificial Intelligence Lab and is working, through robotics, to change the way we understand the world.

author: Sebastian Wernicke
description: After making a splash in the field of bioinformatics, Sebastian Wernicke moved on to the corporate sphere, where he motivates and manages multidimensional projects.

author: Sebastiê£o Salgado
description: Sebastiê£o Salgado captures the dignity of the dispossessed through large-scale, long-term projects.

author: Sergei Lupashin
description: Sergei Lupashin imagines new uses for flying robots. He's a 2014 TED Fellow.

author: Seth Berkley
description: Epidemiologist Seth Berkley is leading the charge to make sure vaccines are available to everyone, including those living in the developing world.

author: Seth Godin
description: Seth Godin is an entrepreneur and blogger who thinks about the marketing of ideas in the digital age. His newest interest: the tribes we lead.

author: Seth Shostak
description: Seth Shostak is an astronomer, alien hunter and bulwark of good, exciting science.

author: Seyi Oyesola
description: Physician Seyi Oyesola co-developed the "Hospital in a Box" _ã a pop-up, portable, solar-powered OR for off-grid medicine in Africa and elsewhere. But, he says, Africa needs more than new tools to heal itself.

author: Shaffi Mather
description: Shaffi Mather is the founder of 1298 for Ambulance, Education Access for All, and co-promoter of Moksha-Yug Access.

author: Shai Agassi
description: Shai Agassi wants to put you behind the wheel of an electric car _ã but he doesn't want you to sacrifice convenience (or cash) to do it.

author: Shai Reshef
description: By offering a tuition-free university education in business or computers, Shai Reshef hopes to transform disadvantaged communities _ã and disrupt higher education as we know it.

author: Shaka Senghor
description: Using literature as a lifeline, Shaka Senghor escaped a cycle of prison and desperation. Now his story kindles hope in those who have little.

author: Shane Koyczan
description: Shane Koyczan makes spoken-word poetry and music. His poem "To This Day" is a powerful story of bullying and survival, illustrated by animators from around the world.

author: Shashi Tharoor
description: After a long career at the UN, and a parallel life as a novelist, Shashi Tharoor became a member of India's Parliament. He spent 10 months as India's Minister for External Affairs, building connections between India and the world.

author: Shawn Achor
description: Shawn Achor is the CEO of Good Think Inc., where he researches and teaches about positive psychology.

author: Shea Hembrey
description: Shea Hembrey explores patterns from nature and myth. A childhood love of nature, and especially birdlife, informs his vision.

author: Shekhar Kapur
description: Shekhar Kapur is a visionary filmmaker and storyteller who works at the intersection of art, myth and activism.

author: Sherwin Nuland
description: A practicing surgeon for three decades, Sherwin Nuland witnessed life and death in every variety. Then he turned to writing, exploring what there is to people beyond just anatomy.

author: Shigeru Ban
description: Most people look at cardboard tubes and see something fit for the recycling bin. But architect Shigeru Ban turns them into beautiful buildings.

author: Shih Chieh Huang
description: Shih Chieh Huang doesn_ã_t make art that_ã_s meant to be admired from afar. He dissects and disassembles the detritus of our lives_ãhousehold appliances, lights, computer parts, toys_ãand transforms them into surreal experiences.

author: Shimon Schocken
description: Shimon Schocken is a computer science professor and dedicated educator.

author: Shimpei Takahashi
description: Shimpei Takahashi thinks we should forget about analyzing data or sales figures and just come up with ideas _ã lots and lots of ideas.

author: Shlomo Benartzi
description: Shlomo Benartzi uses behavioral economics to study how and why we plan well for the future (or fail to), and uses that to develop new programs to encourage saving for retirement.

author: Shubhendu Sharma
description: Eco-entrepreneur Shubhendu Sharma _ã and his company, Afforestt _ã create afforestation methods that make it easy to plant maintenance-free, wild and biodiverse forests.

author: Shyam Sankar
description: An advocate of human-computer symbiosis, Shyam Sankar looks for clues in big and disparate data sets.

author: Siddhartha Mukherjee
description: When he_ã_s not ferreting out the links between stem cells and malignant blood disease, Siddhartha Mukherjee writes and lectures on the history (and future) of medicine.

author: Siddharthan Chandran
description: Siddharthan Chandran explores how to heal damage from degenerative disorders such as MS and motor neuron disease (ALS).

author: Siegfried Woldhek
description: Siegfried Woldhek knows faces _ã he's drawn more than 1,100 of them. Using sophisticated image analysis and his own skills as an artist, he's come up with a fascinating discovery about Leonardo Da Vinci.

author: Simon Anholt
description: Simon Anholt helps national, regional and city governments earn better reputations_ãnot by launching advertising or PR campaigns, but by changing the way they behave.

author: Simon Berrow
description: Simon Berrow is a marine biologist dedicated to studying and preserving the basking shark.

author: Simon Lewis
description: Simon Lewis is the author of "Rise and Shine," a memoir about his remarkable recovery from a car accident and coma, and his new approach to our own consciousness.

author: Simon Sinek
description: Simon Sinek explores how leaders can inspire cooperation, trust and change. He's the author of the classic "Start With Why"; his latest book is "Leaders Eat Last."

author: Ken Robinson
description: Creativity expert Sir Ken Robinson challenges the way we're educating our children. He champions a radical rethink of our school systems, to cultivate creativity and acknowledge multiple types of intelligence.

author: Martin Rees
description: Lord Martin Rees, one of the world's most eminent astronomers, is an emeritus professor of cosmology and astrophysics at the University of Cambridge and the UK's Astronomer Royal. He is one of our key thinkers on the future of humanity in the cosmos.

author: Sonaar Luthra
description: Sonaar Luthra is the creator of Water Canary, a water-testing device that collects real-time water-quality data from the field.

author: Sophal Ear
description: Sophal Ear leads research on post-conflict countries _ã looking at the effectiveness of foreign aid and the challenge of development in places like his native land, Cambodia.

author: Spencer Wells
description: Spencer Wells studies human diversity _ã the process by which humanity, which springs from a single common source, has become so astonishingly diverse and widespread.

author: Srdja Popovic
description: Srdja Popovic was a founder and leader of the student movement that brought down the Milosovic regime. Now, he helps other nonviolent movements learn and grow.

author: Srikumar Rao
description: Executive, educator, writer and life coach Srikumar S. Rao asks, "Are you ready to succeed?" _ã and in his famous course "Creativity and Personal Mastery," he teaches his students how to do so.

author: Stanley McChrystal
description: General Stanley McChrystal is the former commander of U.S. and International forces in Afghanistan. A four-star general, he is credited for creating a revolution in warfare that fuses intelligence and operations.

author: Stefan Sagmeister
description: Renowned for album covers, posters and his recent book of life lessons, designer Stefan Sagmeister invariably has a slightly different way of looking at things.

author: Stefan Wolff
description: Stefan Wolff studies contemporary conflicts, focusing on the prevention and settlement of ethnic conflicts and in postconflict reconstruction in deeply divided and war-torn societies.

author: Stefon Harris
description: Stefon Harris plays the vibraphone _ã and leads a jazz ensemble with a collaborative sound built on collective inspiration.

author: Stephen Burt
description: In his influential poetry criticism, Stephen Burt links the contemporary with the classical, pinpoints new poetry movements, and promotes outstanding little-known poets.

author: Stephen Cave
description: Philosopher Stephen Cave wants to know: Why is humanity so obsessed with living forever?

author: Stephen Coleman
description: Stephen Coleman studies applied ethics, particularly the ethics of military and police force, and their application to human rights.

author: Stephen Friend
description: Inspired by open-source software models, Sage Bionetworks co-founder Stephen Friend builds tools that facilitate research sharing on a massive and revolutionary scale.

author: Stephen Hawking
description: Stephen Hawking's scientific investigations have shed light on the origins of the cosmos, the nature of time and the ultimate fate of the universe. His bestselling books for a general audience have given an appreciation of physics to millions.

author: Stephen Palumbi
description: Stephen Palumbi studies the way humanity and ocean life interact and intertwine. His insights into our codependence offer ideas for protecting both the ocean and ourselves.

author: Stephen Petranek
description: Stephen Petranek untangles emerging technologies to predict which will become fixtures of our future lives _ã and which could potentially save them.

author: Stephen Wolfram
description: Stephen Wolfram is the creator of Mathematica and Wolfram|Alpha, the author of A New Kind of Science, and the founder and CEO of Wolfram Research.

author: Steve Howard
description: Steve Howard leads the sustainability effort at Ikea, helping the low-price-furniture giant to bring sustainable products to millions of people.

author: Steve Jurvetson
description: Venture capitalist Steve Jurvetson (he brought you Hotmail) is one of the most influential funders and thinkers in Silicon Valley. He's also an enthusiastic hobbyist, blogger and Flickr-er.

author: Steve Ramirez
description: When Steve Ramirez published his latest study in Science, it caused a media frenzy. Why? Because the paper was on implanting false memories in the brains of mice.

author: Steve Silberman
description: Steve Silberman is a writer and contributing editor for Wired who covers science and society. His newest book explores neurodiversity and the link between autism and genius.

author: Steve Truglia
description: Stuntman and record-setter Steve Truglia is planning perhaps the ultimate high dive: a parachute jump from the edge of space, 120,000 feet (36.5 kilometers) up.

author: Steven Addis
description: Steven Addis is a father and photography buff who, by day, harnesses the power of branding for social change.

author: Steven Cowley
description: Steven Cowley directs the UK's leading fusion research center. Soon he'll helm new experiments that may make cheap fusion energy real on a commercial scale.

author: Steven Johnson
description: Steven Berlin Johnson examines the intersection of science, technology and personal experience.

author: Steven Levitt
description: Steven Levitt's eye-opening Freakonomics took economic theory into the real world of suburban parenting and urban drug gangs, turning conventional wisdom upside-down.

author: Steven Pinker
description: Linguist Steven Pinker questions the very nature of our thoughts _ã the way we use words, how we learn, and how we relate to others. In his best-selling books, he has brought sophisticated language analysis to bear on topics of wide general interest.

author: Steven Schwaitzberg
description: Dr. Steven Schwaitzberg is on a mission to teach surgeons around the world to perform minimally invasive surgery. But first, he's had to find the right technology to allow communication across the language barrier.

author: Steven Strogatz
description: In his work in applied mathematics, Steven Strogatz studies the way math and biology intersect.

author: Stew
description: Singer-songwriter Stew spins improvisatory songs drawn from his seemingly endless stable of stories and ideas. His musical Passing Strange won a Tony for Best Book in 2008.

author: Sting
description: He_ã_s sold more than 100 million albums and earned 16 Grammy Awards, yet Sting continues to surprise. His fourteenth solo album, The Last Ship, features songs from his Broadway-bound musical of the same name.

author: Stuart Brown
description: Stuart Brown's research shows play is not just joyful and energizing _ã it's deeply involved with human development and intelligence. Through the National Institute for Play, he's working to better understand its significance.

author: Stuart Firestein
description: Stuart Firestein teaches students and _ãcitizen scientists_ã that ignorance is far more important to discovery than knowledge.

author: Dayananda Saraswati
description: Swami Dayananda Saraswati is an acclaimed spiritual teacher and the founder of AIM for Seva _ã a charitable trust that works to relieve poverty across India.

author: T. Boone Pickens
description: A legendary oil and gas entrepreneur, T. Boone Pickens is now on a mission to enhance U.S. energy policies to lessen the nation_ã_s dependence on OPEC oil.

author: Takaharu Tezuka
description: Architect Takaharu Tezuka creates imaginative and versatile personal spaces.

author: Tal Danino
description: Tal Danino explores the emerging frontier of combining biology and engineering (and art). He is a 2015 TED Fellow.

author: Tal Golesworthy
description: Tal Golesworthy is an engineer and entrepreneur, working in research and development of combustion and air pollution control _ã until he decided to innovate in his own health.

author: Tasso Azevedo
description: Tasso Azevedo has helped reduce the rate of deforestation in Brazil_ã_s Amazon rainforest by 75 percent _ã and inspired similar efforts around the world.

author: Taylor Wilson
description: At 14, Taylor Wilson became the youngest person to achieve fusion _ã with a reactor born in his garage. Now he wants to save our seaports from nuclear terror.

author: Teddy Cruz
description: Teddy Cruz looks for clues to the "city of the future" in the emerging urban areas of today.

author: Teitur
description: Whether they_ã_re sung in in English or his native Faroese, Teitur laces his deceptively innocent songs with often stinging hooks.

author: Gustavo Dudamel and the Teresa Carreê±o Youth Orchestra
description: The Teresa Carreê±o Youth Orchestra is the national high-school-age youth orchestra of El Sistema, made up of the best young musicians from throughout Venezuela. Gustavo Dudamel, himself a product of El Sistema, is the new musical director of the LA Philharmonic.

author: Theaster Gates
description: Theaster Gates is a potter whose ambitions stretch far beyond the wheel and the kiln. In Chicago, his leadership of artist-led spaces has catalyzed interest and excitement in a formerly neglected neighborhood, as he uses culture as a transformational weapon.

author: Thom Mayne
description: Founder of the influential studio Morphosis, and co-founder of the Southern California Institute of Architecture, Pritzker Prize-winning architect Thom Mayne marries conceptual ideas with form, challenging the way we perceive structure, building and the environment.

author: Thomas Barnett
description: Strategic planner Thomas Barnett has advised US leaders on national security since the end of the Cold War. His bold ideas about the future of warfare and the military are spelled out in his best-selling book The Pentagon's New Map.

author: Thomas Dolby
description: Thomas Dolby has spent his career at the intersection of music and technology. He was an early star on MTV, then moved to Silicon Valley, then went back on the road with his album, "A Map of the Floating City."

author: Thomas Goetz
description: Thomas Goetz is the co-founder of Iodine and author of "The Decision Tree: Taking Control of Your Health in the New Era of Personalized Medicine._ã

author: Thomas Heatherwick
description: Thomas Heatherwick is the founder of Heatherwick Studio, an architecture and design firm that, among other projects, designed the astonishing "Seed Cathedral" for the UK Pavilion at Shanghai Expo 2010.

author: Thomas Insel
description: The Director of the National Institute of Mental Health, Thomas Insel supports research that will help us understand, treat and even prevent mental disorders.

author: Thomas P. Campbell
description: Thomas P. Campbell, director of The Metropolitan Museum of Art, aims to make the venerable museum's offerings both narrative-driven and accessible.

author: Thomas Peschak
description: Thomas Peschak strives to merge photojournalism and cutting edge science to create powerful media projects that tackle critical marine conservation issues.

author: Thomas Piketty
description: Thomas Piketty is an economist and professor at the Paris School of Economics. His 2014 book, "Capital in the Twenty-first Century," caused a sensation upon publication.

author: Thomas Suarez
description: Thomas Suarez, a 12 year old, taught himself to build iphone apps.

author: Thomas Thwaites
description: Thomas Thwaites is a designer "of a more speculative sort," he says.

author: Tim Berners-Lee
description: Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web. He leads the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C), overseeing the Web's standards and development.

author: Tim Ferriss
description: Tim Ferriss is author of bestseller The 4-Hour Workweek, a self-improvement program of four steps: defining aspirations, managing time, creating automatic income and escaping the trappings of the 9-to-5 life.

author: Tim Harford
description: Tim Harford's writings reveal the economic ideas behind everyday experiences.

author: Tim Jackson
description: Tim Jackson studies the links between lifestyle, societal values and the environment to question the primacy of economic growth.

author: Tim Leberecht
description: As chief marketing officer at NBBJ, Tim Leberecht helps spark and nurture new thinking (and great design) for companies around the world.

author: Timothy Bartik
description: The author of "Investing in Kids," Timothy Bartik studies state and local economies _ã and analyzes the benefits of preschool as an economic development program.

author: Timothy Prestero
description: Timothy Prestero loves a flashy "concept car." But in his own work, he aims to design products for social impact, keeping users in mind.

author: Toby Shapshak
description: The publisher and editor of Stuff magazine, Toby Shapshak is a South African writer focusing on innovation _ã and the role it plays in Africa.

author: Tod Machover
description: At MIT's Media Lab, Tod Machover creates boundary-breaking new music, often using new instruments and music technologies he has invented.

author: Todd Humphreys
description: Todd Humphreys studies GPS, its future, and how we can address some of its biggest security problems.

author: Tom Rielly
description: Traditionally, Tom Rielly closes the TED Conference with a merciless 18-minute monologue, skewering all the speakers with his deadpan delivery, spot-on satire and boundary-less performance (complete with PowerPoint, pratfalls and partial nudity).

author: Tom Shannon
description: Tom Shannon's mixed-material sculpture seems to levitate _ã often it actually does _ã thanks to powerful magnets and clever arrangements of suspension wire. He designed the TED Prize trophy.

author: Tom Thum
description: Hip-hop musician Tom Thum whirls together beatboxing, performance and an array of mouthsounds.

author: Tom Uglow
description: As creative director in the Google Creative Lab, Tom Uglow sees a disconnect with how we design to deliver information and what makes us happy.

author: Tom Wujec
description: Tom Wujec studies how we share and absorb information. He's an innovative practitioner of business visualization _ã using design and technology to help groups solve problems and understand ideas. He is a Fellow at Autodesk.

author: Tony Fadell
description: As the originator of the iPod, Tony Fadell is no stranger to disruptive technology. With Nest, he_ã_s zeroed in on tech_ã_s most elusive targets: household appliances.

author: Tony Robbins
occupation: Life coach; expert in leadership psychology
description: Tony Robbins makes it his business to know why we do the things we do. The pioneering life coach has spoken to millions of people through his best-selling books and three-day seminars.

author: Tony Wyss-Coray
description: At his lab at Stanford School of Medicine, Tony Wyss-Coray studies aging _ã and potential cures for it.

author: Topher White
description: Through his startup Rainforest Connection, Topher White transforms used cell phones into guardians of the rainforest.

author: Travis Kalanick
description: As Uber's co-founder and CEO, Travis Kalanick is disrupting an entrenched industry and reinventing urban transportation.

author: Trevor Aaronson
description: An investigative journalist who reports on the FBI_ã_s misuse of informants in counterterrorism operations, Trevor Aaronson asks the question: Is the United States catching terrorists or creating them?

author: Tristram Stuart
description: Tristram Stuart sounds the warning bell on global food waste, calling for us to change the systems whereby large quantities of produce and other foods end up in trash heaps.

author: Tristram Wyatt
description: Do humans have pheromones? Tristram Wyatt is on the case. A researcher at Oxford, Wyatt is interested in the evolution of pheromones throughout the animal kingdom.

author: Trita Parsi
description: Trita Parsi delves into Middle Eastern history and politics, uncovering fresh perspectives on Iranian, Israeli, and U.S. relations _ã and discovers potential solutions to brewing conflicts.

author: Tshering Tobgay
description: Acting on his mandate to move Bhutan into the 21st century, Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay is transforming his nation _ã while maintaining its _ãGross National Happiness._ã

author: Tyler DeWitt
description: Tyler DeWitt recognizes that textbooks are not the way to get young people interested in science. Instead, he teaches science by making it fun and fantastical.

author: Tyrone Hayes
description: Tyrone Hayes studies frogs and amphibians _ã and the effects on their bodies of common farming chemicals.

author: Ueli Gegenschatz
description: Ueli Gegenschatz took flight just about every way a human can: paragliding, skydiving, BASE jumping (from the Eiffel Tower), and most breathtakingly: by donning a wingsuit and soaring.

author: Uri Hasson
description: Why do great thoughts and stories resonate so strongly with so many people, and how do we communicate them? Using fMRI experiments, Uri Hasson is looking for the answers.

author: Ursus Wehrli
description: Comedian and cabaret artist Ursus Wehrli is on a crusade to tidy up art.

author: Usman Riaz
description: Young guitarist Usman Riaz pulls a rich, swirling sound out of the acoustic guitar.

author: Van Jones
occupation: Social justice and green energy activist
description: Van Jones sees a clear link between soclal justice and green energy _ã and works for both.

author: Vik Muniz
description: Vik Muniz delights in subverting a viewer's expectations. He uses unexpected materials to create portraits, landscapes and still lifes, which he then photographs.

author: Vilayanur Ramachandran
description: Neurologist V.S. Ramachandran looks deep into the brain_ã_s most basic mechanisms. By working with those who have very specific mental disabilities caused by brain injury or stroke, he can map functions of the mind to physical structures of the brain.

author: Vilayanur Ramachandran
description: Neurologist V.S. Ramachandran looks deep into the brain_ã_s most basic mechanisms. By working with those who have very specific mental disabilities caused by brain injury or stroke, he can map functions of the mind to physical structures of the brain.

author: Vinay Venkatraman
description: Vinay Venkatraman aims to design technological devices for the "bottom of the pyramid" rather than simply for the affluent.

author: Vincent Cochetel
description: Vincent Cochetel is the Director of the Bureau for Europe at the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR).

author: Vincent Moon
description: Global wanderer Vincent Moon explores and documents vanishing traditions with his evocative ethnomusical films.

author: Vint Cerf
description: Vint Cerf, now the chief Internet evangelist at Google, helped lay the foundations for the internet as we know it more than 30 years ago.

author: Vusi Mahlasela
description: South African singer-songwriter Vusi Mahlasela was a crucial artistic voice during the fight against apartheid, and now in the new modern-day nation. Blending traditional African music with soul and blues, his music showcases powerful vocals and poetic lyrics.

author: Wadah Khanfar
description: As the Director General of Al Jazeera from 2003-2011, Wadah Khanfar worked to bring rare liberties like information, transparency and dissenting voices to repressive states and political hot zones.

author: Wade Davis
description: A National Geographic Explorer-in-Residence, Wade Davis has been described as _ãa rare combination of scientist, scholar, poet and passionate defender of all of life_ã_s diversity._ã

author: Wael Ghonim
description: Wael Ghonim believes that the Internet can be the most powerful platform for connecting humanity, if we can bring civility and thoughtful conversations back to it.

author: Wayne McGregor
description: Wayne McGregor and his dancers explore the uncharted territory where mind and movement intersect.

author: Wes Moore
description: Wes Moore's life transformed with these words out of his mother's mouth: "I'm sending you to military school." The author of the book, "The Other Wes Moore," he is now a vocal advocate for America's youth as well as for fellow veterans returning from Iraq and Afghanistan.

author: Will Marshall
description: At Planet Labs, Will Marshall is helping share near-real-time images of our planet, from a constellation of earth-observing satellites.

author: Will Potter
description: Award-winning journalist and author, Will Potter focuses on the animal rights and environmental movements, and civil liberties in the post-9/11 era.

author: Willard Wigan
description: Willard Wigan sculpts figures small enough to fit on the head of a pin. To create these microscopic masterpieces, he works diligently through the stillest hours of the night, between his own heartbeats.

author: William Black
description: William Black is a professor of economics and law at University of Missouri, Kansas City.

author: William Kamkwamba
description: To power his family's home, young William Kamkwamba built an electricity-producing windmill from spare parts and scrap _ã starting him on a journey detailed in the book and film "The Boy Who Harnessed the Wind."

author: William McDonough
description: Architect William McDonough believes green design can prevent environmental disaster and drive economic growth. He champions _ãcradle to cradle_ã design, which considers a product's full life cycle _ã from creation with sustainable materials to a recycled afterlife.

author: William Ury
description: William Ury is a mediator, writer and speaker, working with conflicts ranging from family feuds to boardroom battles to ethnic wars. He's the author of "Getting to Yes."

author: Willie Smits
description: Willie Smits has devoted his life to saving the forest habitat of orangutans, the "thinkers of the jungle." As towns, farms and wars encroach on native forests, Smits works to save what is left.

author: Wingham Rowan
description: Wingham Rowan's work bridges the gap between flexible work schedules and modern financial markets.

author: Wolfgang Kessling
description: Wolfgang Kessling and his team at Transsolar designed the solar cooling and comfort concepts that helped Qatar win the bid for the 2022 football World Cup.

author: Woody Norris
description: Woody Norris is a serial inventor of electronics, tools and cutting-edge sonic equipment _ã such as the LRAD acoustic cannon.

author: Xavier Vilalta
description: Barcelona-based architect Xavier Vilalta works in Europe, Africa and the Middle East. He adopts and updates traditional design principles to construct modern buildings that truly suit their environment.

author: Xu Liu
description: In his groundbreaking work, Xu Liu investigated how to activate and deactivate specific memories in mice.

author: Yanis Varoufakis
description: Yanis Varoufakis thinks we need a radically new way of thinking about the economy, finance and capitalism.

author: Yann Arthus-Bertrand
description: With photography, Yann Arthus-Bertrand has captured the beauty of the Earth. Through video and film, his latest projects bind together ecology and humanism. For him, it's all about living together.

author: Yann Dall'Aglio
description: Yann Dall'Aglio is a philosopher who thinks deeply about modern love.

author: Yoav Medan
description: With his team, Yoav Medan is developing a tool for incision-less surgery via focused ultrasound.

author: Yochai Benkler
description: Yochai Benkler has been called "the leading intellectual of the information age." He proposes that volunteer-based projects such as Wikipedia and Linux are the next stage of human organization and economic production.

author: Young-ha Kim
description: One of the premiere writers of his generation, Korean novelist Young-ha Kim weaves tales that speak to the thrills and challenges of young Koreans in our increasingly globalized and ever-changing world.

author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: In his book "Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind," Yuval Noah Harari asks: "What made homo sapiens the most successful species on the planet?"

author: Yves Behar
description: Yves Behar has produced some of the new millennium's most coveted objects, like the Leaf lamp, the Jawbone headset, and the XO laptop for One Laptop per Child.

author: Yves Morieux
description: BCG's Yves Morieux researches how corporations can adapt to a modern and complex business landscape.

author: Yves Rossy
description: With a jet-powered wing attached to his body, Yves Rossy expands the possibilities of human flight.

author: Zak Ebrahim
description: Groomed for terror, Zak Ebrahim chose a different life. The author of The Terrorist's Son, he hopes his story will inspire others to reject a path of violence.

author: Ze Frank
description: Ze Frank rose to fame on a viral video _ã in 2001! He has been making online comedy, web toys and massively shared experiences (like the addictive Young Me Now Me) ever since.

author: Ziauddin Yousafzai
description: Despite an attack on his daughter Malala in 2012, Ziauddin Yousafzai continues his fight to educate children in the developing world.

author: Ziyah Gafic
description: To help him come to terms with the tragedy of his own homeland, Bosnian photographer Ziyah Gafic turns his camera on the aftermath of conflict, showing his images in galleries, in books and on Instagram.

author: Anders Fjellberg
description: For the Norwegian newspaper Dagbladet, Anders Fjellberg investigated the story of "The Wetsuitman," along with his co-author, photographer Tomm Christiansen.

author: Michael Archer
description: Paleontologist Michael Archer is working to bring back his favorite extinct animal: the Tasmanian tiger.

author: Craig Venter
description: In 2001, Craig Venter made headlines for sequencing the human genome. In 2003, he started mapping the ocean's biodiversity. And now he's created the first synthetic lifeforms _ã microorganisms that can produce alternative fuels.

author: Dan Berkenstock
description: Dan Berkenstock and his team at Skybox Imaging are rethinking how to take photographs from space.

author: Dan Cobley
description: Dan Cobley is a marketing director at Google, where he connects customers and businesses, helping both navigate digital space to find what they need.

author: Gregory Petsko
description: Gregory Petsko is a biochemist who studies the proteins of the body and their biochemical function. Working with Dagmar Ringe, he's doing pioneering work in the way we look at proteins and what they do.

author: Hod Lipson
description: Hod Lipson works at the intersection of engineering and biology, studying robots and the way they "behave" and evolve. His work has exciting implications for design and manufacturing _ã and serves as a window to understand our own behavior and evolution.

author: Jeff Bezos
description: As founder and CEO of Amazon.com, Jeff Bezos defined online shopping and rewrote the rules of commerce, ushering in a new era in business. Time magazine named him Man of the Year in 1999.

author: Joel Levine
description: Joel Levine studies the atmospheres of Earth and Mars, looking at their origin, evolution, structure and chemistry and climate change. He's the principal investigator of the proposed ARES Mars Airplane Mission.

author: Nathan Myhrvold
description: Nathan Myhrvold is a professional jack-of-all-trades. After leaving Microsoft in 1999, he's been a world barbecue champion, a wildlife photographer, a chef, a contributor to SETI, and a volcano explorer.

author: Noah Wilson-Rich
description: Noah Wilson-Rich studies bees and bee diseases. He founded Best Bees Company to support people who want to own and care for their own beehive.

author: Ron Eglash
description: Ron Eglash is an ethno-mathematician: he studies the way math and cultures intersect. He has shown that many aspects of African design _ã in architecture, art, even hair braiding _ã are based on perfect fractal patterns.

author: Salvatore Iaconesi
description: An artist, hacker and interaction designer, Salvatore Iaconesi embarked on a bold open-source project in 2012. Subject: his own brain cancer

author: Larry Page
description: Larry Page is the CEO and cofounder of Google, making him one of the ruling minds of the web.

author: Sugata Mitra
description: Educational researcher Sugata Mitra is the winner of the 2013 TED Prize. His wish: Build a School in the Cloud, where children can explore and learn from one another.

author: Theo Jansen
description: Theo Jansen is a Dutch artist who builds walking kinetic sculptures that he calls a new form of life. His "Strandbeests" walk the coastline of Holland, feeding on wind and fleeing from water.

author: Tony Porter
description: Tony Porter is an educator and activist who is internationally recognized for his effort to end violence against women.

author: Yasheng Huang
description: Yasheng Huang asks us to rethink our ideas about China and other large emerging economies. Lately he_ã_s been asking, Does democracy hinder or promote economic growth?

author: Yossi Vardi
description: Investor Yossi Vardi is godfather to more than 40 startups, mostly in the jumping Israeli high-tech sector. He's a legendary community-builder, connector and prankster.

author: Zeresenay Alemseged
description: Zeresenay "Zeray" Alemseged digs in the Ethiopian desert, looking for the earliest signs of humanity. His most exciting find: the 3.3-million-year-old bones of Selam, a 3-year-old hominid child, from the species Australopithecus afarensis.

author: Bart Weetjens
description: The founder of Apopo, Bart WeetÔ_jens, is trainÔ_ing rats to detect landmine explosives in minute amounts.

author: Bran Ferren
description: Once known for entertaining millions by creating special effects for Hollywood, theme parks and Broadway, Applied Minds cofounder Bran Ferren now solves impossible tech challenges with previously unimaginable inventions.

author: Bruno Maisonnier
description: Bruno Maisonnier founded Aldebaran Robotics, maker of the tiny, compelling humanoid Nao.

author: Bruno Torturra
description: Journalist and photographer Bruno Torturra is the face of Media Ninja, a Brazilian digital collective making headlines for its ability to cover big news as it happens.

author: Christopher "moot" Poole
description: Christopher "moot" Poole is founder of 4chan, an online imageboard whose anonymous denizens have spawned the web's most bewildering _ã and influential _ã subculture.

author: Elliot Krane
description: At the Lucile Packard Children's Hospital at Stanford, Elliot Krane works on the problem of treating pain in children.

author: Emiliano Salinas
description: Emiliano Salinas, the son of former Mexican president Carlos Salinas de Gortari, is helping communities throughout Mexico organize and peacefully respond to escalating violence.

author: Eric Liu
description: Eric Liu is a civics educator and founder of Citizen University, which brings together leaders, activists and practitioners to teach the art of effective and creative citizenship.

author: Eric Sanderson
description: Armed with an 18th-century map, a GPS and reams of data, Eric Sanderson has re-plotted the Manhattan of 1609, just in time for New York's quadricentennial.

author: Evan Grant
description: Evan Grant works with cymatics, the art of visualizing sound, and is the founder of the arts and technology collective seeper.

author: Frank Warren
description: Frank Warren is the creator of the PostSecret Project, a blog full of secrets anonymously shared via postcard.

author: Frederick Balagadde
description: TED Senior Fellow Frederick Balagadde invented the micro-chemostat, a first-of-its-kind, dime-sized piece of transparent plastic that can orchestrate the behavior of living cells.

author: Jack Choi
description: Jack is the CEO of Anatomage, a company specializing on 3D medical technology.

author: John Wilbanks
description: Imagine the discoveries that could result from a giant pool of freely available health and genomic data. John Wilbanks is working to build it.

author: Josh Luber
description: Josh Luber is the founder of Campless, a company that collects, analyzes and publishes data and derived insight related to collectible sneakers and the industry.

author: Keith Schacht

author: Andrew Solomon
